fail.text: You chase leads through dust and bureaucracy until your eyes ache. Everything is ‘missing,’ ‘misfiled,’ or ‘pending.’ Whether by incompetence or design, the truth stays buried. You return with nothing sharp enough to use, only the fatigue of fighting a system that doesn’t want to be fair.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Clerk
outcomes.desc: Make the record say what you need. A little ink can change a life.

success.text: You find the clerk who values coin more than conscience and speak in the universal language of payment. A page goes missing. A testimony is ‘misread.’ A seal lands where it shouldn’t. The outcome bends. Your friend breathes again—and you gain a kind of influence that doesn’t feel honorable but does feel real.

fail.text: The clerk recoils, offended or frightened, and the attempt becomes evidence all its own. Word slips sideways through the court, and suddenly your ‘help’ looks like corruption. Even if your friend survives the verdict, your name takes a dirty mark that can be used against you later.

outcomes.title: Let the Law Run
outcomes.desc: Stay silent, watch carefully, and learn how judgment is actually made.

success.text: You keep your face steady and your voice absent. You watch who speaks, who flinches, and who looks relieved at certain testimony. It’s brutal, but instructive. You leave with a clearer picture of the court’s true incentives—and a smaller, calmer fatigue, as if restraint has conserved something in you.

fail.text: Your silence is read as betrayal by the only person you meant to protect. And the crowd reads it too: as cowardice, as calculation, as proof you care only when it’s safe. You learn something, yes—but you pay with a small public bruise to your reputation.

name: A Patron’s Request
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, a patron smiles as if you belong to their success. They ask for a ‘small service’ in a tone that makes it clear the service is only small to *them*. This is how power reproduces: favors traded like coins, obligations tucked into velvet. You can accept, negotiate, probe for the trap, or refuse where others can see—knowing refusal is its own kind of insult.

outcomes.title: Accept Dutifully
outcomes.desc: Do the work, take the reward, swallow the taste.

success.text: You comply without complaint. They like that.

fail.text: You stumble, or hesitate, or disappoint. The smile stays. The hook sinks deeper.

outcomes.title: Set Terms
outcomes.desc: Make the price explicit so the debt is measurable.

success.text: You negotiate as an equal. They humor you—and pay.

fail.text: They decide you’ve forgotten your place.

outcomes.title: Investigate Motives
outcomes.desc: Find the knife hidden inside the gift.

success.text: You learn who the request harms—and why that matters.

fail.text: Your questions get noticed. Not punished—just watched.

outcomes.title: Decline Publicly
outcomes.desc: Keep your conscience. Pay in access.

success.text: The hall hears your refusal and calls it courage. The patron calls it inconvenient.

fail.text: You misstep, and the refusal becomes humiliation—yours.

name: Matchmaker’s Whisper
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, a matron with excellent memory and sharper etiquette draws you into a polite corner. She speaks of "a most suitable match"—names never quite said, intentions never quite confirmed. By the time you realize it, you’re already part of the evening’s entertainment: a possibility to be discussed, weighed, improved, or dismissed. In a hall like this, even rumors have teeth. You can play along, cut it cleanly, find the hand behind it, or turn the conversation into a weapon.

outcomes.title: Smile and Let It Spread
outcomes.desc: Treat it as flattering. A little attention can be useful—if you keep it on your terms.

success.text: You accept the insinuation with practiced ease—neither confirming nor denying, just letting the room imagine what it wants. Doors open when people believe you’re being "considered." You leave the feast slightly elevated, as if you’ve become worth watching for the right reasons.

fail.text: You push too hard, or smile too widely, and the room reads desperation where you meant poise. The whispers don’t stop—they sharpen. The evening ends with your name attached to an unflattering story that travels faster than you do.

outcomes.title: Find Who Benefits
outcomes.desc: A rumor this clean was polished by someone. Trace the hands that polished it.

success.text: You follow the small tells: who repeats the rumor, who corrects it, who waits to see your reaction. The trail leads to a petty faction’s leverage play—harmless on the surface, sharp beneath. You walk away with names and motives, which is to say: ammunition.

fail.text: The more you watch, the more you become watched. You spend the evening counting smiles and measuring pauses until your nerves feel raw. You learn little, and what you gain isn’t worth the fatigue.

outcomes.title: Refuse With Grace
outcomes.desc: Decline without insult. In a court, "no" is an art form.

success.text: You offer a refusal that sounds like principle instead of fear—calm, final, and impossible to argue with without looking small. The rumor loses oxygen. Some respect you for it. Some decide you’re harder to steer than they hoped.

fail.text: You say the right words in the wrong tone, or the wrong words at the wrong moment. The matron’s smile tightens. The room hears a slight where you meant restraint, and your access to certain circles cools for a while.

outcomes.title: Make It Someone Else’s Problem
outcomes.desc: Redirect the attention. If the hall wants a story, give it a better target than you.

success.text: You laugh softly, offer a carefully chosen compliment about someone *else*, and let the matchmaker’s instincts do the rest. Within minutes the room is chewing on a new narrative—one that keeps your name out of the sharpest parts. You leave richer in quiet leverage, and perhaps with a small gift pressed into your palm by someone grateful for your discretion.

fail.text: Your redirection is noticed. The matron’s eyes narrow—not angry, just assessing. You’ve demonstrated you can twist a room, and that makes you interesting in a dangerous way. People begin to watch you more closely than before.

name: Broken Wheel
prompt: Outside Briarwatch, where the frontier keeps its teeth, the failure is sudden and final: a crack like a snapped bone, then the sickening tilt of your cart—or the sag of a pack rig—dumping weight into the mud. The sun is already dropping, and the road ahead is the kind that grows teeth after dusk. You can hear distant life on the wind: a dog barking, a wagon far off, maybe nothing at all. Whatever you decide, it has to happen now. Night does not negotiate.

outcomes.title: Fix It Yourself
outcomes.desc: Kneel in the dirt, take stock of the damage, and make something hold with wood, rope, and stubborn focus.

success.text: You strip the rig down to its essentials and rebuild it into something uglier but functional. The repair won’t impress anyone, but it will carry you. You’re back on the road before the last light fully dies, and the small victory feels like saving your own life with your hands.

fail.text: The break is worse than it looked. A peg splinters, a knot slips, and each failed attempt costs you more rope, more patience, more daylight. When you finally give up, you’ve lost precious materials and gained the heavy fatigue of fighting the inevitable.

outcomes.title: Muscle Through
outcomes.desc: Abandon comfort and carry what you can. If the road won’t take the weight, your body will.

success.text: You lash what remains into a crude harness and haul it forward step by step. It’s brutal, but it works. Someone sees you—traveler, farmer, guard—and the sight of sheer refusal to stop becomes a story that follows you. You arrive sore, poorer in provisions, richer in reputation.

fail.text: You try to brute-force the road into obedience and it answers with pain. A strap bites, a load shifts, and you take a hard twist or a crushing stumble. You make it out, but the injury lingers—an insult you’ll carry longer than the gear you saved.

outcomes.title: Borrow What You Need
outcomes.desc: Find a nearby traveler or homestead and ask as if it’s reasonable—because sometimes confidence is half the bargain.

success.text: You speak plainly, offer a promise that sounds like it will be kept, and make your need feel shared rather than begged. A wheelwright’s scrap, a spare peg, a length of cord—small mercies, but enough. You leave with a repaired rig and a thin thread of goodwill you can tug again later.

fail.text: Your request lands wrong: too bold, too needy, too entitled. Doors close, faces tighten, and you feel the social temperature drop. Even if you find a workaround, you walk away with the sting of being refused in a way others will remember.

outcomes.title: Steal a Replacement
outcomes.desc: If it’s unattended, it’s yours. Survival is a better excuse than pride.

success.text: You find what you need behind a shed or beside a sleeping wagon: a spare wheel, a usable yoke, a bundle of cordage. You take it quickly and leave nothing but absence. The repair is almost elegant in how neatly it solves your problem—and how neatly it creates a new one if you’re ever recognized.

fail.text: A lantern swings. Someone wakes. A voice calls out, and suddenly your ‘quick theft’ becomes an accusation with witnesses. You get away, but the road gains one more story about you—one the wrong people might take seriously.

name: Snowed-In Pass
prompt: At Frostbarrow Pass, where winter bargains hard and mercy is expensive, the pass disappears under fresh snowfall as if the mountain has decided you don’t deserve to cross. Wind cuts the breath out of you. The world narrows to white, stone, and the cruel arithmetic of cold. Waiting means burning supplies and time. Pushing forward means risking the slope, the drop, the sudden silence of a buried path. Somewhere nearby, smoke might mean shelter—or strangers who won’t ask nicely before taking what you have.

outcomes.title: Climb Through
outcomes.desc: Force your way over the teeth of the mountain. No delay. No retreat.

success.text: You lead yourself like a stubborn animal: step, breath, step. You find footholds where none should exist and refuse to let the cold bargain with you. When you crest the worst of it, the world opens again. Later, people talk about the one who crossed when the pass said no.

fail.text: The mountain takes payment. You stumble through drifts that swallow your legs, fight wind that steals your warmth, and keep moving long after you should have stopped. You survive—but you come out hollowed, shaking, and deeply spent.

outcomes.title: Chart a Detour
outcomes.desc: Accept the delay and choose the route that kills you slower.

success.text: You read the land the way you read a page—looking for the parts that repeat and the parts that lie. You find a longer route that stays lower and calmer. It costs you time and provisions, but you keep your bones intact and your odds intact.

fail.text: Your ‘detour’ becomes a slow trap: false turns, dead ends, and exposed stretches where the wind punishes every mistake. By the time you find anything like a workable path, you’ve eaten through far more than you planned.

outcomes.title: Sneak Into a Lodge
outcomes.desc: Warmth stolen is still warmth. Slip inside, take what you need, leave before dawn.

success.text: You find the lodge by smoke and silhouette. A window latch gives, a door yields, and you tuck yourself into borrowed heat. You eat something hot, dry your layers, and leave before anyone wakes. Whatever fatigue was chewing at you loosens its grip—at least for now.

fail.text: A board creaks like a shout. A dog barks. A voice demands to know who’s there. You flee into the snow with the sting of attention behind you—someone has a reason to remember you now, and they may share it.

outcomes.title: Treat With Locals
outcomes.desc: Pay for a roof and a bowl. Let hospitality be bought instead of stolen.

success.text: You approach openly, offer coin without posturing, and speak like a person who understands that winter is everyone’s enemy. They take you in—not lovingly, but pragmatically. You leave fed, resupplied, and with a small thread of goodwill in a place where goodwill is usually scarce.

fail.text: Your offer is taken as insult or suspicion. Maybe you smell like trouble. Maybe you look too capable. Maybe they simply can’t afford another mouth. You pay anyway—coin spent for nothing—and walk away with a small, public rejection that doesn’t feel good in a cold place.

name: Campfire Visitors
prompt: Outside Briarwatch, where the frontier keeps its teeth, your fire is a beacon, and beacons draw ships—sometimes wrecks. Footsteps approach beyond the light’s edge. A few figures emerge with palms open and voices soft. They claim to be travelers. They might be. They might also be hungry, desperate, armed, or simply opportunistic. In the dark, intent is hard to read. The choice you make now decides whether this night becomes a story you tell… or one told about you.

outcomes.title: Share the Fire
outcomes.desc: Offer warmth, a little food, and the dignity of being treated like human beings. Trust is a gamble—sometimes it pays.

success.text: You make space and set clear boundaries—firm, but not cruel. The strangers relax, and the conversation becomes ordinary: roads, weather, warnings. One of them repays your generosity with a small favor, a useful connection, or a promise that feels sincere. You sleep more deeply than expected, the tension easing out of your shoulders.

fail.text: Hospitality invites appetite. While you look at one face, another hand drifts toward your pack. By the time you notice, something is gone—food, rope, a small necessity you only miss when it matters. They vanish back into the dark, leaving you with embers and loss.

outcomes.title: Question Them Carefully
outcomes.desc: Keep them talking. People reveal themselves when you ask the right thing at the right time.

success.text: You ask about landmarks that don’t exist, villages that burned years ago, a bridge that was never built—and watch the answers. The lies come out uneven, and the truth shows through the cracks. You learn who they are, what they want, and what road ahead is dangerous. When they leave, you’re still cautious, but you’re also better prepared—and you salvage a little extra from the encounter.

fail.text: The conversation drags. They dodge, you probe, they probe back. The night becomes a tense negotiation that never fully resolves. Even if no blade is drawn, you don’t sleep—at least not properly—and you wake with your nerves worn thin.

outcomes.title: Send Them Away
outcomes.desc: Draw a line and hold it. Make it clear the fire is not communal.

success.text: You rise, square your shoulders, and make your refusal unmistakable. The strangers weigh you and decide this camp isn’t worth the trouble. They fade back into the trees, and the message carries: you are not easy prey.

fail.text: Your refusal becomes the spark. One of them steps too close, and suddenly it’s hands and knives in firelight. You drive them off, but not cleanly. When the dark goes quiet again, you’re left with a fresh hurt and the sour knowledge of how close that came to worse.

outcomes.title: Slip Away First
outcomes.desc: Leave no trace, no target. Let them find an empty fire and nothing else.

success.text: You douse the coals, pack quickly, and vanish into the dark before they’re close enough to commit. You learn a useful truth about the road—how quickly danger forms around comfort—and you carry that lesson forward like a private advantage.

fail.text: In your hurry, you lose time and gear. A strap snaps, a bundle spills, footsteps quicken behind you. You escape, but the night taxes you anyway—taking food and necessities as the price for staying alive.

name: The Toll Road
prompt: In Marrowgate, where tolls are tradition and corruption is a local craft, a rope across the road, a crude gate, and a man with a ledger that looks a little too clean for the mud around him. He claims official authority, names a lord you’ve heard of, and flashes papers that are plausible at a glance and suspicious on the second look. Behind him stand a few hard-eyed ‘assistants’ who don’t smile. Whether he’s legitimate or a thief in ink-stained clothing, he wants coin. The road is narrow. Turning back costs time. Going forward costs something else.

outcomes.title: Pay and Pass
outcomes.desc: Sometimes you buy peace. Hand over coin and move on before it becomes a conversation.

success.text: You pay without drama and keep your eyes forward. The tollkeeper grins like a man who has won, but you keep your life uncomplicated. The road opens, and you take the small victory of continuing uninjured and uninterrupted.

fail.text: You pay—and still they take something from the exchange. A sneer, a comment meant to belittle, a moment where bystanders see you ‘comply’ and file it away as weakness. It isn’t a real wound, but it stings in the social way that can linger.

outcomes.title: Demand Proof
outcomes.desc: Make them show their hand. Real officials don’t mind scrutiny—fake ones hate it.

success.text: You ask the right questions: which office issued the writ, what seal should look like up close, what the toll is ‘supposed’ to fund. The tollkeeper stumbles, and the assistants shift in a way that answers you more clearly than words. You walk away not just past the gate, but with useful knowledge—names, methods, tells you can use again.

fail.text: You argue until your breath fogs and your patience frays. They don’t crack; they simply waste your time with practiced certainty and vague threats. You leave—one way or another—feeling like you spent an hour wrestling a wall.

outcomes.title: Threaten the Fraud
outcomes.desc: Force the gate with reputation and steel. Make them believe this is the wrong road to die on.

success.text: You step close enough that they have to measure you honestly. Your voice carries the promise of consequence, and your posture suggests you’ve delivered on worse promises before. They back down, not bravely, but pragmatically. You take the road and a small gain from their scattered ‘toll’ stores—because they’re too eager to let you go to argue over it.

fail.text: The tollkeeper’s assistants are waiting for someone to be brave. When you push, they push back. You get through, but you pay in pain—a quick blow, a hard shove, a cut you didn’t have a moment earlier.

outcomes.title: Forge Your Own Pass
outcomes.desc: Meet fraud with fraud. Give them paperwork that makes their paperwork irrelevant.

success.text: You produce a document that looks official enough to intimidate a liar—names, dates, the right kind of confidence. For a heartbeat, the tollkeeper doubts themselves, and doubt is all you need. The rope lifts, and you pass while they’re still deciding whether to challenge you. The trick teaches you something valuable about how authority is faked.

fail.text: They recognize the bluff—or decide to treat any bluff as an excuse for violence. Your ‘pass’ becomes evidence, and their attention sharpens into a kind of pursuit that doesn’t require proof to be dangerous.

name: Crumbling Shrine
prompt: At Verdemont Abbey, where vines climb stone and confession is a kind of currency, a roadside shrine leans like an old man who refuses to sit. Weather has gnawed the carvings smooth. The offering bowl still holds a few coins, a ribbon, a small charm of wood and wire. Someone still cares enough to leave something—yet no one cares enough to repair it. The air is quiet in that specific way that makes you feel watched, even if there’s nothing there. You can honor the place, study it, steal from it, or leave it to rot as the world does.

outcomes.title: Restore It
outcomes.desc: Set stones back into place, clear the ruin, and leave the shrine better than you found it—if only by a little.

success.text: You work with patient hands: stacking stones, sweeping debris, righting what can be righted. It isn’t grand, but it’s real. Later, someone passes and sees the shrine standing straighter, and they remember that someone cared. If your name has been bruised, this quiet act smooths it—because sincerity is hard to argue with.

fail.text: The work takes more out of you than expected. Cold stone, stiff joints, and the slow grind of effort without immediate reward. You manage something, but not enough to feel finished, and you leave with fatigue clinging to you like dust.

outcomes.title: Study the Carvings
outcomes.desc: Trace the worn symbols and old prayers. Faith leaves patterns—even when people forget why.

success.text: You find meaning in the weathered lines: a regional mark, a half-erased name, a devotional phrase tied to a larger tradition. The shrine isn’t just a broken roadside trinket—it’s connected. The knowledge gives you a small foothold in the networks of belief and charity that keep the world stitched together.

fail.text: You linger too long in damp air and cold stone shadow. Whether it’s chill, mold, or bad luck, something settles into your lungs and bones. You walk away with a cough that wasn’t there before.

outcomes.title: Take the Offerings
outcomes.desc: Need makes thieves of saints. If the world won’t provide, you’ll provide for yourself.

success.text: You lift the coins and the small usable items with practiced speed, telling yourself it’s only metal and food and nobody will miss it. The gain is immediate and practical. The discomfort comes later, in the quiet moment when you remember someone left those offerings for a reason.

fail.text: A passerby sees you with your hand in the bowl. Or you fumble, making noise where there should be reverence. However it happens, the act becomes known—and people are strangely unforgiving about theft when it wears the mask of sacrilege.

outcomes.title: Leave It Alone
outcomes.desc: Walk on without touching what isn’t yours. Let the shrine keep whatever dignity it has left.

success.text: You offer nothing but restraint, and sometimes that’s the cleanest gift. You move on with your conscience quieter than it might have been, and the road feels a little less heavy.

fail.text: You leave it behind. The world does not reward you for it—at least not today.

name: An Old Veteran’s Tale
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a scarred veteran speaks like someone who has stopped pretending the world is fair. They offer lessons—for coin, for respect, or for a favor you won’t understand until later. Their stories are entertaining, but the useful parts are the ones they don’t dramatize: small decisions made under pressure, and the ways people lie to themselves to keep moving.

outcomes.title: Pay for Lessons
outcomes.desc: Spend coin to buy hard-earned clarity.

success.text: You leave with a handful of tricks and a quieter fear of the obvious.

fail.text: You pay and learn less than you hoped. The disappointment follows you home.

outcomes.title: Earn It in Sparring
outcomes.desc: Prove you’re worth the time.

success.text: You take bruises and turn them into respect.

fail.text: You take the wrong bruise. The lesson arrives in pain.

outcomes.title: Ask What He Won’t Brag About
outcomes.desc: Get the truths hidden between the heroic parts.

success.text: He gives you names, dates, and the quiet shape of old betrayals.

fail.text: He resents the questions and makes you feel it.

outcomes.title: Flatter Him Into Talking
outcomes.desc: Let pride loosen the locked parts of the story.

success.text: He boasts. You listen. You leave richer than you look.

fail.text: He sees through it and decides you’re the kind of person who’d sell a friend’s name.

name: Sealed Coffer
prompt: In Gloambridge, where every tavern has a scholar and a spy, you find a sealed coffer with no crest and no explanation. It doesn’t hum with magic. It hums with *importance*—the kind that gets couriers killed and makes honest men lie. The lock is clean. The wood is old. Whoever owned it expected it to arrive somewhere, and it did not.

outcomes.title: Pick the Lock
outcomes.desc: Quiet hands, quick answers.

success.text: You open it without breaking the seal. Inside: coin and a hint of the story it belonged to.

fail.text: You fumble and leave evidence. Someone will know the coffer was touched.

outcomes.title: Break It Open
outcomes.desc: Noise now. Profit now.

success.text: Splinters fly. The contents spill. You take the coin and pretend you never wondered who it was for.

fail.text: The lid gives way badly. You cut yourself and draw the wrong kind of attention.

outcomes.title: Deliver It for a Fee
outcomes.desc: Let honesty be a service you sell.

success.text: You return it to someone who looks relieved and annoyed in equal measure. They pay you to leave quickly.

fail.text: They accept it—and treat you like part of the problem that delivered it.

outcomes.title: Hide It Briefly
outcomes.desc: Keep it for a moment when you need leverage.

success.text: You stash it somewhere safe enough to calm your nerves—unsafe enough to keep you thinking about it.

fail.text: You pick the wrong place, or someone picks you. The coffer becomes a spotlight.

name: Scribe’s Error
prompt: In Kestrelbank, where bridges and ledgers decide who eats, a mistake in ink can ruin you as thoroughly as a blade. Somewhere in a ledger, your name has been placed where it doesn’t belong—taxes you don’t owe, a crime you didn’t commit, a debt that isn’t yours. The people who trust paper more than faces will treat the record as truth. Correcting it means time, politics, and patience. Ignoring it means consequences that compound. And the quietest solution—the one done with forged strokes—risks becoming a crime of your own.

outcomes.title: Correct the Record
outcomes.desc: Fix it properly, in daylight. Bring evidence, endure the clerks, and make the ink obey reality.

success.text: You gather proof, chase stamps, and corner the right clerk at the right hour. The correction is slow, but it lands. A line is scratched out. A new line replaces it. The world becomes marginally safer because the paper agrees with you again.

fail.text: The office resists you with a thousand small refusals: ‘come back tomorrow,’ ‘wrong counter,’ ‘missing seal.’ Whether incompetence or malice, it eats your day and leaves you drained, with nothing resolved.

outcomes.title: Pay to Make It Go Away
outcomes.desc: Coin buys silence and stamps. It’s unfair, but it’s fast.

success.text: You pay the ‘fee’ that isn’t written anywhere official and watch the clerk’s attitude soften instantly. The record doesn’t become righteous—it becomes quiet. Your coin disappears, but so does the worst of the social stink clinging to your name.

fail.text: You pay, and the office still finds a way to take more. The mistake remains half-alive, and now you’ve also spent coin you couldn’t spare. The problem becomes a debt-shaped shadow that follows you out the door.

outcomes.title: Alter It Quietly
outcomes.desc: A little ink, a big change. If the system lies about you, lie back—better.

success.text: You pick a moment when the office is distracted and the right ledger is unattended. A careful smudge, a rewritten line, a number that becomes a different number. The record agrees with you again, and you walk away with the private knowledge that paper is only as honest as the hand holding the pen.

fail.text: Someone sees the movement of your hand or notices the wrong kind of confidence in your posture. The ledger snaps shut like a trap, and suspicion attaches itself to you. Even if you escape, the danger has a new, official flavor.

outcomes.title: Endure the Consequences
outcomes.desc: Take the hit and outlast the record. Survive the paperwork long enough to fix it later.

success.text: You absorb the indignity, keep your head down when needed, and refuse to let the mistake define you. People see you endure and keep functioning anyway, and that stubborn steadiness becomes its own kind of respect. You mark a future moment to correct this properly—when you have the time, leverage, and strength to finish the fight.

fail.text: The consequences compound faster than your patience. A missed payment becomes a penalty; a penalty becomes a demand; a demand becomes a threat. By the time you realize you can’t simply ‘endure,’ the mistake has grown teeth—and you are drowning in it.

name: Border Toll
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a rope barrier and a bored sergeant stop the road. A ledger is opened, a hand is held out. The toll is small—until they decide you look like trouble.

outcomes.title: Pay Without Fuss
outcomes.desc: Pay and move on before questions become inspections.

success.text: You pay the posted rate. The sergeant barely looks up, and the rope lifts as if it were never there.

fail.text: The sergeant 'misreads' the fee. You pay more than you should, but arguing would cost more than coin.

outcomes.title: Find the Right Stamp
outcomes.desc: Produce the right paper—or make it look right.

success.text: You point to a clause, a seal, a date. The sergeant grunts and waves you through. Someone nearby notices you know the rules.

fail.text: You cite the wrong ordinance. Laughter ripples down the line; the sergeant makes a show of correcting you.

outcomes.title: Slip Through the Side Path
outcomes.desc: There’s a goat track. There’s also brush that hides patrols.

success.text: You leave the road, take the track, and rejoin the highway beyond the rope. You keep your coin—and learn how porous law really is.

fail.text: A patrol steps out where you thought there was only shadow. Their looks say you were expected.

outcomes.title: Turn It Into a Favor
outcomes.desc: Offer help the guards actually want: a message carried, a name remembered.

success.text: You volunteer for a small errand and they remember your face as useful, not suspect.

fail.text: You wait too long, talk too much, and end up doing menial work in the cold. You pass through—but tired.

name: Wet Wood, Cold Fire
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, rain turns the world into a gray sheet. Your tinder is damp, your fingers numb. Night arrives with a hungry kind of silence.

outcomes.title: Spend Supplies
outcomes.desc: Burn what you must to keep warmth and morale.

success.text: You sacrifice a little now to avoid losing much later. The fire holds, small but stubborn.

fail.text: You burn more than you meant. The night is survivable—but your pack is thinner.

outcomes.title: Build a Better Shelter
outcomes.desc: Work the problem: windbreak, drainage, dry core.

success.text: Your shelter stays dry enough to save your tinder. In the morning you even find usable kindling.

fail.text: You labor until your shoulders ache, but the rain still finds its way in. You wake sore and short-tempered.

outcomes.title: Steal a Merchant’s Charcoal
outcomes.desc: A cart nearby is covered—but not locked.

success.text: You take a pouch of charcoal and leave no trace. The fire catches fast, and the guilt catches slower.

fail.text: A shout cuts the rain. Someone saw your hand disappear under canvas.

outcomes.title: Endure It Unwarmed
outcomes.desc: Bear the cold. Let it pass through you.

success.text: You keep watch through the worst of it. Others sleep because you didn’t.

fail.text: By dawn your joints burn and your throat is raw. The cold took its due while you pretended it couldn’t.

name: Broken Cart Axle
prompt: In Gilderhaven’s shipyards, where storms are politics and insurance is prayer, a small cart lies cockeyed in the ditch, axle snapped. The driver looks at you like you’re either salvation or another spectator.

outcomes.title: Lift and Haul
outcomes.desc: Put your back into it and set it right.

success.text: Wood groans, wheels roll, and the cart finds level ground again. Gratitude travels faster than wagons.

fail.text: You strain until your breath tastes like metal. The cart moves—but you pay in fatigue.

outcomes.title: Jury-Rig the Axle
outcomes.desc: Splints, lashings, and patience.

success.text: Your fix is ugly but functional. The driver presses coin into your palm like it’s a secret.

fail.text: The lashings slip on the first test. You lose time and materials before conceding.

outcomes.title: Offer Quiet Extortion
outcomes.desc: Help… for a price high enough to sting.

success.text: You name a fee. They pay, bitterly. Your purse is heavier; your name, a shade lighter.

fail.text: They shout your greed to the roadside. Bystanders remember.

outcomes.title: Call in a Favor
outcomes.desc: Use Influence—find someone who owes you, or pretend they do.

success.text: A nearby foreman recognizes your authority—or your audacity. Hands are found, and the cart is righted with minimal fuss.

fail.text: No one bites. You spend an hour trying to look important. It doesn’t work.

name: The Lonely Shrine
prompt: At Verdemont Abbey, where vines climb stone and confession is a kind of currency, a roadside shrine—stone bowl, faded icon, a stub of candle. Someone has left a tiny offering: bread, a copper, a ribbon.

outcomes.title: Leave an Offering
outcomes.desc: Give something small. Buy goodwill from whatever listens.

success.text: You leave coin and a quiet promise. The act steadies you more than you expected.

fail.text: You fumble the ritual and feel silly for it. Still—an offering is an offering.

outcomes.title: Study the Iconography
outcomes.desc: Read the weathered marks for meaning.

success.text: Under grime and moss, you find a symbol that doesn’t belong. Someone repurposed this shrine for something else.

fail.text: You learn only that stone erodes and stories blur. Nothing more.

outcomes.title: Take the Copper
outcomes.desc: If no one is watching, is it theft or just… redistribution?

success.text: You pocket the copper and walk away. The road feels colder behind you.

fail.text: As you touch the offering, your skin prickles. Something in the air shifts, like a breath held too long.

outcomes.title: Repair the Shrine
outcomes.desc: Stack stones, clear weeds, relight a candle.

success.text: You leave it better than you found it. Travelers will notice—and some will ask who did it.

fail.text: You do what you can, but the rain takes it back before you’re even gone.

name: Night Camp Whispers
prompt: Outside Briarwatch, where the frontier keeps its teeth, your fire is low. Nearby travelers speak in murmurs—plans, names, the sound of coin. They glance your way, measuring.

outcomes.title: Keep Watch
outcomes.desc: Stay awake and let the night pass on your terms.

success.text: Nothing happens. That’s a victory the cautious understand.

fail.text: Your eyes blur. You jerk awake to find your pack lighter.

outcomes.title: Join Their Talk
outcomes.desc: Make yourself part of the circle before you become a target.

success.text: You trade stories and keep your questions gentle. By the end, you have a contact and a shared joke.

fail.text: You say one thing too sharp. The murmurs stop. You learn nothing—and feel watched.

outcomes.title: Eavesdrop Quietly
outcomes.desc: Listen. Gather. Keep your hands clean.

success.text: You catch a name and a destination. It could be leverage. It could be trouble.

fail.text: A voice calls you out. The word 'spy' is said loud enough to travel.

outcomes.title: Pick a Pocket
outcomes.desc: Quick fingers, quick exit.

success.text: A purse disappears. You’re gone before suspicion turns into certainty.

fail.text: A blade flashes in the firelight. You escape with blood on your sleeve and anger in their eyes.

name: Petitioners' Hall
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, a hall of waiting faces: farmers with caps in hands, merchants with ledgers, guards with bored eyes. Somewhere beyond a curtain, decisions are made.

outcomes.title: Speak for the Smallfolk
outcomes.desc: Use your voice to lend theirs weight.

success.text: You speak plainly and without flourish. People nod. Even the clerk stops scratching for a moment.

fail.text: You are interrupted, corrected, dismissed. The crowd’s sympathy turns into pity.

outcomes.title: Draft a Proper Petition
outcomes.desc: Words, format, precedent—make it unignorable.

success.text: You turn grievances into something the court can’t pretend it doesn’t understand.

fail.text: You miss a required seal and the clerk sends you away with a sigh.

outcomes.title: Whisper the Right Name
outcomes.desc: A hint of patronage can open doors—or shut them.

success.text: You name someone with power. The guard’s posture changes. The curtain opens just enough.

fail.text: You name the wrong person. A guard’s hand settles on their baton, slow and certain.

outcomes.title: Wait Patiently
outcomes.desc: Sometimes the safest move is to be forgettable.

success.text: Hours pass. Eventually your turn arrives, and you are neither favored nor punished.

fail.text: The hall closes early. You’ve lost a day and gained only stiffness.

name: A Rumor at Table
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, a laugh behind a goblet. A name spoken softly. Someone offers you a rumor like a sweet—dangerous and irresistible.

outcomes.title: Deflect with Grace
outcomes.desc: Turn gossip into nothing.

success.text: You smile, change the topic, and leave the rumor to rot on the tablecloth.

fail.text: Your deflection is too sharp; someone thinks you’re hiding something.

outcomes.title: Verify Quietly
outcomes.desc: Ask questions that don’t look like questions.

success.text: By dessert you know what’s true, what’s false, and who wants you to repeat it.

fail.text: You chase the rumor in circles. You learn only that someone is enjoying the chase.

outcomes.title: Trade a Secret
outcomes.desc: Give a little to get a lot.

success.text: You pay in whispers and receive something sharper in return.

fail.text: You give more than you get. The room feels smaller afterward.

outcomes.title: Call It Out
outcomes.desc: Put a torch to the rumor and see who flinches.

success.text: Someone pales. Someone excuses themselves. You’ve made an enemy—but also a point.

fail.text: The court laughs at you instead. The rumor grows teeth and finds your name.

name: The Herald’s Notice
prompt: At Ashqar’s oasis court, where shade and law trade places by noon, a herald reads proclamations until words lose meaning—then your ears catch one: new restrictions, new taxes, new punishments.

outcomes.title: Learn the Letter of It
outcomes.desc: Understand what has actually changed.

success.text: You parse the language and find the loophole hidden in plain sight.

fail.text: The wording is slippery. You leave with half a truth and a full headache.

outcomes.title: Publicly Support It
outcomes.desc: Align yourself with authority.

success.text: You nod at the right moment. The herald’s eyes remember you.

fail.text: Someone hisses 'bootlicker'. The crowd’s mood turns against you.

outcomes.title: Sow Doubt
outcomes.desc: Quietly encourage resistance.

success.text: You plant questions like seeds. People carry them away in their pockets.

fail.text: A guard hears your tone. Their stare lingers too long.

outcomes.title: Leave Before It Matters
outcomes.desc: Avoid being seen reacting at all.

success.text: You slip out. No one remembers your face, and that’s sometimes the point.

fail.text: You hesitate and get jostled. Nothing happens—except you’re now part of the crowd’s memory.

name: The Masked Benefactor
prompt: At Ashqar’s oasis court, where shade and law trade places by noon, a figure in a half-mask requests a private word. They offer assistance—coin, introductions, protection—in exchange for a future promise.

outcomes.title: Accept the Patronage
outcomes.desc: Take the hand offered and worry later.

success.text: You agree. The promise feels light—until it isn’t.

fail.text: They decide you’re too risky. The offer evaporates with a polite bow.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: Make the promise narrower. Make it survivable.

success.text: You rewrite the future in careful clauses. They smile—sharp approval.

fail.text: They tire of your caution and move on.

outcomes.title: Investigate the Mask
outcomes.desc: Who is this, really?

success.text: You notice the accent, the ring, the perfume. Pieces of identity fall into place.

fail.text: Your probing is noticed. Their guard steps between you like a door closing.

outcomes.title: Refuse Cleanly
outcomes.desc: Decline without insult. Keep your freedom.

success.text: You walk away unbought. Someone sees it and admires the spine.

fail.text: You offend them despite your care. A subtle pressure follows you afterward.

name: The Auditor’s Quill
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, an auditor’s clerk asks to see accounts, papers, receipts. Their quill pauses at your name like it has been waiting for it.

outcomes.title: Produce Clean Records
outcomes.desc: If you’re innocent, prove it.

success.text: You hand over neat papers. The clerk’s interest fades—disappointed.

fail.text: You can’t find a document. The pause becomes a note in the margin.

outcomes.title: Bribe for Expedience
outcomes.desc: Buy speed. Buy silence.

success.text: Coin slides under parchment. The clerk’s quill resumes like nothing happened.

fail.text: The clerk looks offended—then interested. Your bribe becomes leverage.

outcomes.title: Forge a Missing Receipt
outcomes.desc: Make the paper say what it must.

success.text: Ink dries. The ledger closes. You feel the cliff edge you just stepped away from.

fail.text: The clerk’s finger smears the ink. Their eyes sharpen.

outcomes.title: Turn Tables With Questions
outcomes.desc: Ask what they’re really looking for.

success.text: The clerk reveals, by accident, the target of the audit. Useful knowledge travels upward.

fail.text: You overplay it. The clerk writes something you wish they hadn’t.

name: A Stolen Seal
prompt: In a back room, a thief shows you a wax seal still attached to a strip of parchment. ‘Worth more than coin,’ they whisper. ‘If you know where to press it.’

outcomes.title: Buy It
outcomes.desc: Pay now. Use later.

success.text: You pay, and the thief disappears. The seal is warm in your pocket like a living thing.

fail.text: You reach for coin and meet a blade’s tip. You pay anyway—more than agreed.

outcomes.title: Test Its Origin
outcomes.desc: Confirm whose it is before you touch fate.

success.text: You identify the house by a tiny flaw in the imprint. The seal has a story—and enemies.

fail.text: You can’t place it. A seal without context is just wax.

outcomes.title: Steal It
outcomes.desc: Take it and run. Let the underworld chase your shadow.

success.text: You snatch the seal and vanish into alleys. The thief’s shout becomes a bounty.

fail.text: You get the seal—but not cleanly. Blood marks your trail.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Leave
outcomes.desc: Some offers are traps with velvet lining.

success.text: You walk away. The thief’s smile curdles. You feel lighter for it.

fail.text: They mock your caution loudly. The room turns eyes on you.

name: Street Dice
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a ring of onlookers cheers as dice clatter on a crate. The stakes climb faster than sense. A hustler’s grin invites you in.

outcomes.title: Play Straight
outcomes.desc: Trust luck—and your read of people.

success.text: You win small, leave early, and keep your smile private.

fail.text: Luck turns. You lose, and the crowd forgets you immediately.

outcomes.title: Cheat Better
outcomes.desc: If they’re cheating, you’re just… competing.

success.text: You palm the die, swap the throw. The hustler’s eyes narrow—respect or threat, you can’t tell.

fail.text: A hand grabs your wrist. ‘Thief,’ someone says, and suddenly everyone agrees.

outcomes.title: Break the Game
outcomes.desc: Flip the crate, scatter the dice, end it.

success.text: People scramble. The hustler curses. You leave in the confusion, strangely satisfied.

fail.text: A bottle clips your head. You leave—hurt and hated.

outcomes.title: Watch and Learn
outcomes.desc: Stand back. Study the pattern.

success.text: You see the trick. You also see who pays the hustler to keep the game running.

fail.text: You linger too long and draw attention. You slip away—tired and annoyed.

name: A Ciphered Note
prompt: In Kestrelbank, where bridges and ledgers decide who eats, a folded note is slipped into your hand in the crowd. The symbols aren’t words—until you look at them sideways.

outcomes.title: Crack It Yourself
outcomes.desc: Break the cipher with patience and pattern.

success.text: The message resolves into names and dates. Someone is moving coin—and bodies.

fail.text: You waste hours. The meaning stays just out of reach.

outcomes.title: Hand It to an Expert
outcomes.desc: Find a scribe who owes you—or can be bought.

success.text: The expert translates and looks worried. They charge extra for the worry.

fail.text: The expert refuses. Some knowledge burns to hold.

outcomes.title: Use It as Bait
outcomes.desc: Let the sender think you understood—and see who comes.

success.text: A meeting is arranged. You learn who’s connected to whom.

fail.text: The wrong eyes spot you with the note. The city suddenly has sharper corners.

outcomes.title: Burn It
outcomes.desc: Refuse the hook.

success.text: Flame eats ink. You walk away from a story that wanted you inside it.

fail.text: You hesitate, and someone notices. You leave, but the note’s existence is no longer yours alone.

name: Hidden Alcove
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, behind a loose stone in an inn wall, you find an alcove: a small pouch, a ring, a list of names. Someone meant to return.

outcomes.title: Take Only Coin
outcomes.desc: Leave the list. Keep the simple sin.

success.text: You take coin and leave the rest. Your luck feels… watched.

fail.text: As you pull the pouch free, something snaps—a thread, a ward, a sense.

outcomes.title: Take the List
outcomes.desc: Names are power. Names are danger.

success.text: You copy the list. It’s a map of hidden obligations.

fail.text: Footsteps. You leave in haste, and your panic is remembered.

outcomes.title: Set a Trap
outcomes.desc: Return the stone, watch from shadow.

success.text: You see who returns. The face is valuable knowledge.

fail.text: You wait too long. The night steals your strength.

outcomes.title: Report It
outcomes.desc: Bring it to authority—if you trust them.

success.text: A captain takes the evidence and nods slowly. You’ve chosen a side.

fail.text: They suspect you planted it. Your good deed becomes your stain.

name: Debt Collector’s Knock
prompt: In Gilderhaven’s shipyards, where storms are politics and insurance is prayer, a hard knock at an inconvenient hour. A collector with polite eyes and strong friends asks about money you may or may not owe.

outcomes.title: Pay Something
outcomes.desc: Make the problem smaller.

success.text: You pay enough to buy time. The collector notes it carefully.

fail.text: You pay, but they insist the remainder is still due—soon.

outcomes.title: Prove You Don’t Owe
outcomes.desc: Paper beats threats—sometimes.

success.text: You show the receipt. The collector’s smile thins. They leave… for now.

fail.text: Your records don’t convince. The collector makes sure others hear you’re a dodger.

outcomes.title: Threaten Them Back
outcomes.desc: Make it clear this doorstep is expensive.

success.text: They step back. Respect is fear with better clothing.

fail.text: Their friends arrive. The city reminds you who it belongs to.

outcomes.title: Bribe for Erasure
outcomes.desc: Pay to make your name disappear from the ledger.

success.text: Coin changes hands. The debt becomes a rumor instead of a sentence.

fail.text: They take your coin and keep the ledger. You’ve bought nothing but contempt.

name: Practice Yard Duel
prompt: In the practice yard, a challenger steps forward with blunted steel. Their grin says they want an audience.

outcomes.title: Win Clean
outcomes.desc: Technique, timing, and restraint.

success.text: You land the telling blow. The yard cheers, and your name rises with the noise.

fail.text: A clumsy strike catches your arm. It’s not deadly—just humiliating and painful.

outcomes.title: Outthink Them
outcomes.desc: Feints, footwork, and reading intent.

success.text: You bait their overreach and punish it. Even the veterans nod.

fail.text: Your plan is sound, but your timing isn’t. The bout ends in a messy tie.

outcomes.title: Fight Dirty
outcomes.desc: A knee, a shove, a lesson.

success.text: You win fast. The challenger’s grin dies. The onlookers’ admiration is… complicated.

fail.text: They call you out mid-bout. The crowd turns on you like a tide.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Bout
outcomes.desc: Decline with calm. Let them swing at air.

success.text: You deny them the spectacle. A trainer respects your discipline.

fail.text: Your refusal reads as fear. Someone laughs too loud.

name: Tavern Brawl
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a spilled drink becomes an insult, becomes a shove, becomes a room full of fists. Chairs scrape. Someone locks the door.

outcomes.title: End It Fast
outcomes.desc: Put the loudest down and let the rest reconsider.

success.text: A single decisive blow changes the room’s math. The brawl collapses into mutters.

fail.text: You swing—and eat a bottle for it. Blood and laughter mix.

outcomes.title: Talk Them Down
outcomes.desc: Find the one person everyone listens to.

success.text: Your voice cuts through the noise. People pause, remember consequences, and start backing away.

fail.text: They shout over you. Your attempt becomes the joke.

outcomes.title: Slip Out the Back
outcomes.desc: Let fools break each other while you vanish.

success.text: You leave before anyone decides you’re responsible for anything.

fail.text: A hand catches your cloak and shakes you down on the way out.

outcomes.title: Protect Someone
outcomes.desc: Shield the weak—whether they deserve it or not.

success.text: You drag a terrified patron behind the bar. Someone thanks you later, quietly and sincerely.

fail.text: You take too many hits meant for others. You walk out upright, but drained.

name: Militia Muster
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a captain calls for able hands. Bandits, wolves, raiders—something has townsfolk scared enough to pay for spears.

outcomes.title: Volunteer
outcomes.desc: Join the line. Earn respect the hard way.

success.text: You return with scratches and stories. The captain pays and recommends you.

fail.text: The skirmish goes bad. You return alive, but hurt in a way that lingers.

outcomes.title: Train Them
outcomes.desc: Teach farmers to hold a line.

success.text: They listen. They learn. The captain treats you like someone worth asking twice.

fail.text: They don’t take you seriously. You waste a day and leave frustrated.

outcomes.title: Take the Contract Quietly
outcomes.desc: Offer to handle it yourself—no witnesses, no questions.

success.text: You solve the problem in a way the town can deny knowing about. Payment comes in a plain pouch.

fail.text: Someone sees too much. The captain’s eyes become suspicious.

outcomes.title: Decline and Move On
outcomes.desc: Keep your skin and your schedule.

success.text: You pass through untouched.

fail.text: The town notices your refusal. Cowardice is an easy story to tell.

name: Guarded Caravan
prompt: In Gilderhaven’s shipyards, where storms are politics and insurance is prayer, a merchant caravan offers you temporary work: one road, one payout. They warn you the last caravan lost two guards and all its spice.

outcomes.title: Take the Job
outcomes.desc: Be steel on the road—for coin.

success.text: You earn your pay and keep wagons moving. The merchant pays without argument.

fail.text: Trouble finds you. You keep the caravan safe enough—but not yourself.

outcomes.title: Negotiate Better Pay
outcomes.desc: Make your risk worth it.

success.text: You name a price and the merchant accepts, annoyed but pragmatic.

fail.text: They call you greedy in front of others. Your leverage evaporates.

outcomes.title: Scout Ahead
outcomes.desc: Avoid fights by spotting them first.

success.text: You find a safer route and a cache of usable gear left by someone else’s misfortune.

fail.text: You walk too far, too fast. Nothing happens—except fatigue.

outcomes.title: Skim the Cargo
outcomes.desc: A pinch of spice won’t be missed, will it?

success.text: You take a small fortune’s worth of 'samples'.

fail.text: A merchant’s son counts crates obsessively. Your hand is discovered.

name: Hunt Gone Wrong
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a hunt meant for sport turns sharp. The boar doesn’t flee; it charges. Someone screams. The forest decides who gets to be noble today.

outcomes.title: Face the Beast
outcomes.desc: Stand your ground.

success.text: You meet tusk with steel. The boar falls, and so does the fear in everyone’s eyes.

fail.text: The boar catches you hard. You survive, but pain becomes a companion.

outcomes.title: Coordinate the Hunters
outcomes.desc: Turn chaos into a plan.

success.text: You direct spears, call angles, and the beast is trapped and killed with minimal blood.

fail.text: Your orders conflict and people stumble. The blame finds you.

outcomes.title: Spook It Away
outcomes.desc: Use noise, scent, and misdirection.

success.text: You drive it off long enough for people to regroup. In the retreat you overhear an argument—useful.

fail.text: It turns on you instead. You escape, scraped and shaken.

outcomes.title: Save an Injured Hunter
outcomes.desc: Forget glory—save a life.

success.text: You bind wounds and carry weight. Someone lives because you chose them over the trophy.

fail.text: You struggle under the burden. You manage, but your body protests for days.

name: An Old Map in the Margins
prompt: Near Greyvault’s cliff-carved archives, where the wind tastes like old ink, a book you borrowed for one purpose contains another: a map scribbled in the margins, roads that don’t exist anymore, a mark that might mean treasure—or tragedy.

outcomes.title: Copy the Map
outcomes.desc: Preserve it. Use it later.

success.text: You copy every line. Knowledge becomes something you can carry.

fail.text: Ink blots. You lose a crucial symbol and with it the map’s meaning.

outcomes.title: Ask a Scholar
outcomes.desc: Find someone who recognizes the place names.

success.text: A scholar lights up at the sight. They trade explanation for a small fee.

fail.text: The scholar scoffs and demands more coin than you can justify.

outcomes.title: Keep It Hidden
outcomes.desc: Maps like this create enemies. Keep quiet.

success.text: You tuck the map away and tell no one. It becomes a private door in your mind.

fail.text: You can’t stop yourself from mentioning it. Someone’s interest sparks too quickly.

outcomes.title: Sell the Knowledge
outcomes.desc: Let someone else chase it.

success.text: You sell the secret of the map. The buyer’s smile says you sold more than ink.

fail.text: Word gets around that you traffic in stolen scholarship.

name: Forbidden Marginalia
prompt: In a monastery copy, the margins are filled with a different hand: arguments against doctrine, questions that cut too close, a symbol drawn again and again like a fixation.

outcomes.title: Study It
outcomes.desc: Read the dangerous thoughts carefully.

success.text: You learn an idea that can’t be unlearned. It sticks like burrs.

fail.text: The text makes your head swim. When you look up, you feel oddly watched.

outcomes.title: Report It
outcomes.desc: Bring it to authority. Let them decide.

success.text: They thank you. Quietly. You gain standing in the eyes of those who enforce belief.

fail.text: They suspect you wrote it. The question becomes you.

outcomes.title: Copy Only the Symbol
outcomes.desc: Take the key, leave the sermon.

success.text: You copy the symbol on a slip of paper. It feels like a promise made to something you haven’t met.

fail.text: Ink smears. A monk walks in. Their expression tightens.

outcomes.title: Burn the Page
outcomes.desc: Destroy temptation before it becomes a path.

success.text: Flame eats the margin. You feel lighter, like you dodged a hook.

fail.text: You hesitate and someone sees the scorch mark. You didn’t destroy it, only drew attention.

name: Herbcraft Lesson
prompt: At Verdemont Abbey, where vines climb stone and confession is a kind of currency, a hedge-healer invites you to identify plants by smell and bitterness. 'The world wants to poison you,' they say. 'Learn its language.'

outcomes.title: Learn Diligently
outcomes.desc: Treat it like a craft worth respect.

success.text: You learn what to chew, what to avoid, and what to sell.

fail.text: You confuse two similar leaves and earn a sharp lecture.

outcomes.title: Barter for Remedies
outcomes.desc: Trade coin for salves and teas.

success.text: You buy small comforts against a harsh world.

fail.text: You overpay, but the remedies are still useful.

outcomes.title: Steal a Pouch
outcomes.desc: Take what you can when they turn away.

success.text: You take a pouch of dried herbs. The healer’s eyes never meet yours again.

fail.text: You’re caught mid-reach. The healer curses you in a low voice that feels heavier than words.

outcomes.title: Test Yourself Harshly
outcomes.desc: Taste, endure, prove you’re not fragile.

success.text: You hold the bitterness and keep your composure. Respect is given sparingly—and you receive it.

fail.text: Your stomach rebels. You spend a day in misery, learning the lesson too well.

name: The Scribe’s Error
prompt: In Gloambridge, where every tavern has a scholar and a spy, a clerk miscopies a name in a register. The mistake is small—until you realize the wrong name is yours.

outcomes.title: Correct It Politely
outcomes.desc: Fix the record without making a scene.

success.text: The clerk corrects it and thanks you for discretion.

fail.text: The clerk shrugs and delays. You leave, unresolved.

outcomes.title: Prove It With Evidence
outcomes.desc: Receipts, witnesses, seals.

success.text: You produce proof. The clerk’s quill scratches reluctantly.

fail.text: The clerk demands a fee for the 'work'.

outcomes.title: Exploit the Error
outcomes.desc: A wrong name can become a shield—or a weapon.

success.text: You let the mistake stand and use it to slip past a small obstacle later.

fail.text: Someone notices you noticing. Suspicion grows where it shouldn’t.

outcomes.title: Destroy the Page
outcomes.desc: No record, no problem—until there is.

success.text: The page is ruined, the record lost. You feel powerful for a heartbeat.

fail.text: Guards arrive faster than you expected. The court loves its paperwork.

name: An Astral Omen
prompt: Near Greyvault’s cliff-carved archives, where the wind tastes like old ink, a clear night reveals a strange alignment—one star blinking red as if embarrassed to be seen. Old folk mutter prayers. Scholars mutter theories. You mutter… decisions.

outcomes.title: Treat It as Superstition
outcomes.desc: Don’t let the sky write your life.

success.text: You sleep anyway. In the morning, you feel stubbornly alive.

fail.text: Your defiance feels hollow. The omen sits in your thoughts like grit.

outcomes.title: Seek Interpretation
outcomes.desc: Ask someone who makes meaning for a living.

success.text: You hear a reading that is half wisdom, half theater—and still useful.

fail.text: The interpreter demands more coin, offers less clarity.

outcomes.title: Use It to Move People
outcomes.desc: Omen as rhetoric. Fear as leverage.

success.text: You speak and people listen. The sky gives your words weight.

fail.text: They call you a charlatan. Your performance backfires.

outcomes.title: Mark Yourself
outcomes.desc: Make a small ritual. A vow. A token.

success.text: You complete the ritual. It’s ridiculous—until you feel the world notice you back.

fail.text: The ritual goes wrong. Not disastrously—just enough.

name: The Heir’s Suitors
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, letters arrive with wax seals and fine hands: offers, insinuations, and ‘helpful’ counsel on whom your heir ought to wed. Each comes with a price—spoken or not.

outcomes.title: Choose the Strongest Alliance
outcomes.desc: Pick the match that brings the most leverage, and accept the obligations that follow.

success.text: You bind your house to a name people recognize. Doors open, and so do accounts you did not know you’d owe.

fail.text: Your choice offends a rival family. The polite smiles harden into rumor, and your household feels suddenly smaller.

outcomes.title: Test Them Quietly
outcomes.desc: Send discreet questions through clerks and servants; learn what isn’t written.

success.text: A whispered inquiry returns with a ledger of vices. Useful—if you know when to stop reading.

fail.text: Someone notices your questions. The wrong ear hears your name paired with ‘blackmail.’

outcomes.title: Refuse the Game
outcomes.desc: Announce that your heir will choose freely, and dare the court to scoff.

success.text: Your refusal reads as conviction. Some mock you—others respect you more than they admit.

fail.text: Courtiers smile and move on—around you. Favors you once spent now cost more.

outcomes.title: Take a Dowry Up Front
outcomes.desc: Negotiate coin first; let affection come later.

success.text: Coin changes hands. The match remains ‘honorable’—at least on paper.

fail.text: The offer becomes a story, then a song. None of them are kind.

name: The Physician’s Prognosis
prompt: In Wrenfield, where plague taught people to count breaths and measure trust, a physician with careful eyes asks to see your hands, your tongue, the whites of your eyes. Their answer is measured—but it lands like a hammer all the same.

outcomes.title: Follow the Regimen
outcomes.desc: Rest, bitter teas, and fewer late nights—whether you like it or not.

success.text: You keep to the regimen. The days are dull—but you wake with fewer shadows behind your eyes.

fail.text: You try. You fail. The body keeps its own ledger, and it does not forgive missed payments.

outcomes.title: Seek a Second Opinion
outcomes.desc: Find a different healer—one with different books, or different beliefs.

success.text: Another healer offers reassurance—and a name you can invoke later in polite rooms.

fail.text: A ‘remedy’ leaves you worse. The stink of superstition clings to you for weeks.

outcomes.title: Pay for Discretion
outcomes.desc: Make sure this visit never becomes gossip.

success.text: The physician bows. Your frailty remains your own.

fail.text: Coin dulls tongues—but not all tongues. A rumor escapes, limping into court.

outcomes.title: Ignore It
outcomes.desc: Act as if nothing is wrong. If you walk tall enough, perhaps the body will listen.

success.text: You push through pain and make it look like strength. People remember the posture, not the price.

fail.text: Your vision tunnels. The room tilts. It is hard to command respect when you cannot stand.

name: Old Debts Resurface
prompt: In Marrowgate, where tolls are tradition and corruption is a local craft, a face you haven’t seen in years appears in a doorway—older, sharper, and smiling like they already know what you did to survive.

outcomes.title: Pay Them Off
outcomes.desc: Coin is cheaper than consequences—most days.

success.text: They take the coin and vanish. You sleep that night without listening for steps.

fail.text: They take your coin and keep your name. It was never about money.

outcomes.title: Turn the Tables
outcomes.desc: Remind them you have teeth, too.

success.text: You find the thread they’re hiding and pull. Their smile breaks. You keep what you learn.

fail.text: Your pressure slips, and the snap echoes. Now the law knows there’s a story worth hearing.

outcomes.title: Confess to a Patron
outcomes.desc: Tell a powerful ally first—before the rumor arrives without you.

success.text: A patron absorbs the shock and offers a quiet plan. It costs you pride, but buys you time.

fail.text: Your patron’s face cools. They didn’t buy your loyalty to inherit your scandals.

outcomes.title: Flee the City
outcomes.desc: Leave before the ink dries on any warrant.

success.text: You’re gone before sunrise. The road is cruel, but it doesn’t ask questions.

fail.text: You hesitate—one day too long. Someone recognizes you at the gate.

name: The Slow Road Home
prompt: In Wrenfield, where plague taught people to count breaths and measure trust, the same road you once took in a day now demands two. Every hill feels steeper; every mile asks a price in breath.

outcomes.title: Travel Light
outcomes.desc: Leave comforts behind. Keep only what matters.

success.text: You strip the load to essentials. The pace steadies, and you arrive with something left in you.

fail.text: You discard the wrong thing. A needed tool is gone when you reach for it.

outcomes.title: Hire a Wagon
outcomes.desc: Pay coin to spare your body.

success.text: The wagon rattles, but you endure. Sometimes wisdom is just paying someone else to suffer.

fail.text: The driver takes your coin and your time. You arrive late—and spent.

outcomes.title: Press On Through Pain
outcomes.desc: Refuse to slow. Prove you still can.

success.text: You make the distance. People see the stubbornness and call it strength.

fail.text: Your legs betray you. The cold settles in your bones like a tenant that won’t leave.

outcomes.title: Make Camp Early
outcomes.desc: Stop before the night turns ugly. Eat, rest, and live to travel tomorrow.

success.text: You sleep deeply and rise steadier.

fail.text: Camp is never truly safe. You wake to damp blankets and a dull headache.

name: The Last Muster
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a messenger arrives with a muster order. The realm calls bodies to a banner—and your name is on the list, as if time never touched you.

outcomes.title: Attend as a Captain
outcomes.desc: Stand at the front, give orders, and let younger arms do the lifting.

success.text: You organize the line with calm authority. The levy holds, and your words carry further than your blade.

fail.text: The press becomes chaos. A stray blow finds you before you can retreat behind the ranks.

outcomes.title: Buy a Substitute
outcomes.desc: Pay someone to take your place. Cowardice is just another expense.

success.text: The coin buys silence—and a name written in place of yours.

fail.text: Someone sees the exchange. The story spreads faster than the marching drums.

outcomes.title: Report Illness
outcomes.desc: Claim infirmity and dare anyone to challenge it.

success.text: They grumble, but they let you be. The realm has enough corpses without demanding yours early.

fail.text: A clerk demands proof. The scrutiny feels like a trial.

outcomes.title: Fight in the Line
outcomes.desc: Take a weapon and answer the call the old way.

success.text: You hold your place and refuse to fall. Someone will tell this story as long as they have a tongue.

fail.text: Your shoulder screams as steel bites. Pride is light—until you have to carry it home in pieces.

name: Disputed Testament
prompt: In High Valewyr’s court, where etiquette is a blade with a velvet hilt, a distant cousin produces a ‘true’ copy of a testament, and suddenly your house is a table where strangers sit and count your silver.

outcomes.title: Produce the Original
outcomes.desc: Bring forth the seal, the witnesses, the ink that cannot be argued with.

success.text: You present the original with calm precision. The claimant falters, and the court turns their eyes away from you.

fail.text: Your proof is incomplete. The court smells weakness, and the claimant leans in.

outcomes.title: Buy the Judge’s Attention
outcomes.desc: Coin in the right hand is its own evidence.

success.text: The judgment lands in your favor. The court calls it ‘law.’

fail.text: The bribe is noticed. Worse: it’s documented.

outcomes.title: Settle Quietly
outcomes.desc: Offer a small concession to end the noise before it grows.

success.text: You trade a slice of the pie for silence. It tastes bitter, but the table grows quiet again.

fail.text: They refuse the offer and take the insult to court. Now it’s a spectacle.

outcomes.title: Threaten Their Name
outcomes.desc: Remind them what you know—and what you’re willing to share.

success.text: Their hands shake when you speak. You gain a new secret and an old enemy.

fail.text: They are not afraid. They leave the room smiling, and you realize too late they wanted you to make the threat.

name: Teach the Apprentice
prompt: Near Greyvault’s cliff-carved archives, where the wind tastes like old ink, a bright-eyed apprentice begs for lessons: sword forms, ledger tricks, court etiquette—whatever you’re known for. Teaching is a kind of legacy.

outcomes.title: Teach with Patience
outcomes.desc: Give them the boring truths that actually keep people alive.

success.text: They listen. They learn. People notice you’re the sort who leaves something behind besides rumors.

fail.text: You try to teach, but the hours drain you. The apprentice leaves grateful; you leave tired.

outcomes.title: Demand Payment
outcomes.desc: Lessons are work. Work costs coin.

success.text: Coin comes in a neat purse. Respect comes with it—sometimes.

fail.text: Word spreads that you ‘charge for breath.’ It’s unfair—yet it sticks.

outcomes.title: Teach Them Secrets
outcomes.desc: Show them the shortcuts—dangerous, effective, unforgettable.

success.text: They learn what others won’t teach. You gain a grateful shadow in the city.

fail.text: They talk. Or they’re followed. Either way, your name ends up in someone else’s notes.

outcomes.title: Refuse
outcomes.desc: Legacy is a trap. Let them find their own way.

success.text: You refuse politely and avoid becoming anyone’s crutch. A patron admires the restraint.

fail.text: They leave offended. In a small world, offended people become loud.

name: A Quiet Blackmail
prompt: In the Greenfold, where small villages hide big hungers, a note arrives without signature. It lists three facts only you would know, and ends with a request written as if it’s already agreed upon.

outcomes.title: Pay in Secrets
outcomes.desc: Trade one danger for another. Choose the smaller fire.

success.text: You answer with a secret of your own. The pressure eases, for now.

fail.text: Your secret isn’t good enough. The note returns with a new demand.

outcomes.title: Set a Trap
outcomes.desc: Arrange a meeting. Bring witnesses you trust.

success.text: You catch a courier and follow them back to the source. The name you learn is ugly—but useful.

fail.text: Steel flashes in a narrow alley. You escape, but not unmarked.

outcomes.title: Publicly Denounce It
outcomes.desc: Turn the accusation into theater. If it’s in the open, it can’t control you—right?

success.text: Your outrage convinces the crowd. The blackmailer loses their leverage in the noise.

fail.text: The blackmailer wanted you to shout. Now everyone knows where to aim their curiosity.

outcomes.title: Disappear for a Season
outcomes.desc: Leave town, leave court, leave the story behind.

success.text: You vanish. The rumor starves without you to feed on.

fail.text: You vanish—and someone writes the story for you.

name: Pilgrimage for Rest
prompt: At Verdemont Abbey, where vines climb stone and confession is a kind of currency, you consider a pilgrimage—not for glory, but for quiet. A road walked slowly can still change you, if you survive it.

outcomes.title: Walk the Long Road
outcomes.desc: Take the honest path, step by step.

success.text: The road strips you down and builds you back up. You return lighter—if poorer.

fail.text: The journey drains you. Your body protests with every cold morning.

outcomes.title: Ride with the Hospice Caravan
outcomes.desc: Travel under holy protection—at a cost in favors.

success.text: They shelter you, and you owe them something you can’t quite name yet.

fail.text: You misunderstand a vow and offend a stern prior. Protection is withdrawn at the worst moment.

outcomes.title: Donate for Absolution
outcomes.desc: Give coin and ask for peace in return.

success.text: Your gift is received with solemn words. You feel, briefly, forgiven.

fail.text: The priest’s eyes linger on your hands as if measuring sin by the nails. You leave uneasy.

outcomes.title: Take the Shortcut
outcomes.desc: A rough track through lonely country. Fewer eyes, more risk.

success.text: You beat the weather and the bandits both. There’s pride in arriving early.

fail.text: A fall on loose stone turns into blood and fever.

name: The Knife in the Dark
prompt: In Marrowgate, where tolls are tradition and corruption is a local craft, you wake to the softest sound: cloth on stone, breath held too carefully. Someone is in the room with you, and they did not come to talk.

outcomes.title: Fight From the Bed
outcomes.desc: Grab whatever’s close and make it count.

success.text: You drive them back with raw fury. They flee through the window, leaving blood on the sill and fear in your house.

fail.text: The blade finds you before your feet do. You survive, but the wound changes how you sleep.

outcomes.title: Call for Guards
outcomes.desc: Voice as weapon—authority as armor.

success.text: Boots thunder. The intruder is caught in torchlight. Your household tightens around you like a fist.

fail.text: No one comes fast enough. The intruder escapes, and whispers begin: ‘unprotected,’ ‘declining.’

outcomes.title: Slip into Shadow
outcomes.desc: Leave the bed, leave the obvious path. Let them hunt a ghost.

success.text: You move like you once did. You spot their mark and learn who paid for this attempt.

fail.text: You flee the wrong way and burst into the hall with a weapon in hand. A guard sees you first.

outcomes.title: Parley
outcomes.desc: Offer coin, mercy, or a bargain. Assassins have needs too.

success.text: You name a price, and they accept it. They leave with coin—and a warning you’ll remember.

fail.text: They laugh quietly. Some jobs cannot be bargained with. The air tastes like old rites.

name: The Oathstone Witness
prompt: Frostbarrow Pass is all wind and stone, the kind of place where a promise feels heavier than a blade. At the old oathstone, two parties face each other with pale breath and hard eyes. They need a witness—someone whose name can be dragged into the matter if the word fails. A ring of iron is offered. A bowl of water is set. Everyone looks at you as if you’ve already agreed.

outcomes.title: Bear Witness
outcomes.desc: Stand close. Hear the words. Let your presence make the vow real.

success.text: You hold the moment steady with your voice and posture. The oath is spoken cleanly, and the onlookers nod as if a knot has been tied in the world. When it’s done, someone presses a token of thanks into your palm—less payment than acknowledgment.

fail.text: You speak at the wrong time, or too softly, or with the wrong emphasis—enough that one side later claims you ‘misheard.’ The vow is still made, but your name is now a loose plank in the bridge, ready to be kicked out from under you.

outcomes.title: Read the Fine Words
outcomes.desc: Listen like a scribe. Catch what the proud mouths try to hide.

success.text: You ask for the words to be repeated—slowly. A few glances dart, a throat clears, and a clause is tightened. Later, one of the parties leans close and admits you saved them from a ruin they didn’t want to name aloud.

fail.text: You chase the meaning until the crowd’s patience breaks. The oath is rushed, tempers flare, and you leave with a headache and the sense you missed something important by trying too hard to be clever.

outcomes.title: Take a Quiet Fee
outcomes.desc: Accept ‘gratitude’ in the shadow of the stone and keep your face honest.

success.text: The coin passes palm-to-palm as naturally as breath. No one calls it a bribe. You give your witness with a straight spine, and afterward you can’t quite tell whether the extra weight in your purse feels like fortune or a hook.

fail.text: Someone sees. Worse—someone remembers. The fee becomes a story that spreads faster than the oath itself, and suddenly your ‘witness’ looks purchased. If trouble comes, it won’t just come to them.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Stone
outcomes.desc: Decline. Let them find another name to carry their future.

success.text: You shake your head and step back. The crowd mutters, but the world keeps turning. Still, refusing an oath in a place that worships promises is its own kind of statement, and it leaves an impression—good or bad—on anyone who witnessed your refusal.

fail.text: They push. They plead. They corner you with expectations until your refusal turns into a reluctant presence. The token is pressed into your hand anyway, and you feel the vow settle on you like a borrowed cloak you can’t shrug off.

name: The Broken Vow
prompt: A week later, the iron ring returns—split clean, as if someone snapped it with their hands. The guide is dead in a ditch, the promised cargo gone. The survivors don’t blame the road; they blame the oath. And because you were there, because your name was spoken near the stone, they come to you with grief sharpened into demands.

outcomes.title: Demand Bloodprice
outcomes.desc: Set a price for the broken word and try to stop a feud before it starts.

success.text: You name a number that hurts but doesn’t humiliate. The room goes quiet while people do the arithmetic of honor. At last, heads nod—reluctantly. It’s not peace, but it’s a doorway to it.

fail.text: You aim for balance and land on insult. The wrong person laughs, the wrong person bristles, and suddenly your ‘mediation’ is another injury on the pile. They don’t leave—but they stop listening.

outcomes.title: Hunt the Oathbreaker
outcomes.desc: Take the matter into your own hands and chase the one who made the vow fail.

success.text: You take a handful of names, a direction, and the kind of certainty that makes people step out of your way. If the broken word has a body behind it, you’ll find it—or you’ll leave enough bruises in the world that it finds you first.

fail.text: You volunteer for the chase and immediately learn why others hesitated. The trail leads into hard country and harder people. By the time you turn back, you’ve earned a fresh scar and a fresh enemy.

outcomes.title: Bury the Truth
outcomes.desc: Make the broken vow look like an accident. Let time smother the sparks.

success.text: You move names, shift blame, and push the story toward ‘bandits’ and ‘bad luck’—anything but oathbreaking. People want a neat narrative. You give them one, and keep the jagged truth for yourself.

fail.text: Someone notices the smear of your hand on the story. The lie still holds—for now—but it holds with your fingerprints on it. If the truth surfaces later, it will surface with your name attached.

outcomes.title: Call for Mercy
outcomes.desc: Insist that grief shouldn’t become a blade. Offer care before vengeance.

success.text: You speak about widows, about children, about the kind of winter a feud brings. It doesn’t satisfy the angriest faces, but it steadies enough hands that knives stay sheathed for one more night.
