success.text: You trade future stability for present advantage.

fail.text: Your sale is discovered. People don’t like being treated as merchandise.

name: Major Event: The Trial Ledger
prompt:
At thirty, you’re no longer ‘promising.’ You’re either *something*… or you’re still waiting.

A messenger brings a summons to **Marrowgate**: your name has been entered into a trial ledger.

outcomes.title: Defend Yourself in Full
outcomes.desc: You arrive in person, prepared, and make them meet your eyes.

success.text: You speak like someone who belongs in the room. The accusation loses its teeth.

fail.text: The hearing turns into humiliation. The ledger closes with your name under ‘guilty enough.’

outcomes.title: Find the Real Culprit
outcomes.desc: You dig through accounts until the truth is forced into daylight.

success.text: You pull the thread and the whole lie unravels. Someone else is dragged into the light.

fail.text: You dig and hit stone. Someone has paved over the truth.

outcomes.title: Pay to Make It Go Away
outcomes.desc: You slide coin into the right hands and let the ledger lose interest.

success.text: The problem disappears. So does some of your respect for yourself.

fail.text: You pay—and they keep the accusation anyway. Now you’re poorer and still guilty.

outcomes.title: Flee the Summons
outcomes.desc: If you’re going to be judged, you’d rather be judged from a distance.

success.text: You vanish into roads and small inns. The system can’t hold what it can’t find.

fail.text: You’re intercepted. The summons becomes a chain.

name: Major Event: The Physicker’s Price
prompt:
At thirty, the body begins to keep receipts. A lingering pain in your side, a cough that returns at night.

A traveling physicker offers a diagnosis—and a price.

outcomes.title: Pay for Treatment
outcomes.desc: You buy medicine, rest, and a chance.

success.text: The physicker’s tinctures taste like bitter hope. Over weeks, the cough eases.

fail.text: You pay—and the treatment fails. You feel the wasted coin like salt in a wound.

outcomes.title: Endure and Work
outcomes.desc: You refuse to slow down. You push through the ache.

success.text: You outlast the worst of it by stubbornness alone.

fail.text: You push too hard. The illness deepens and starts to feel like it has a personality.

outcomes.title: Study the Physicker’s Notes
outcomes.desc: Ask questions. Learn the craft. Make knowledge your medicine.

success.text: You learn enough to treat yourself—and maybe others—before it’s too late.

fail.text: You learn just enough to be afraid. The notes suggest a future you don’t want.

outcomes.title: Steal the Medicine
outcomes.desc: If you can’t afford health, you take it.

success.text: You take the kit and disappear. Your cough improves, and your conscience worsens.

fail.text: You’re caught. The physicker calls you a thief loudly enough for the whole town to hear.

name: Major Event: The Borough Fire
prompt:
A minor fire breaks out in a dense neighborhood. Buckets are passed, screams are swallowed by smoke.

You can help—and be seen helping—or you can take advantage of chaos.

outcomes.title: Organize the Line
outcomes.desc: Turn panic into a plan.

success.text: You place people where they need to be. The fire is contained, and your name rides the relief.

fail.text: You organize and still fail. The fire takes more than it should have.

outcomes.title: Haul and Break
outcomes.desc: You carry water until your arms shake.

success.text: You save a home with your hands. The gratitude is immediate and real.

fail.text: A beam falls. You’re lucky to live.

outcomes.title: Loot the Empty Houses
outcomes.desc: Chaos is a curtain. You move behind it.

success.text: You leave with a bag of silver and a stain you won’t wash out.

fail.text: A homeowner catches you and screams your name into the smoke.

outcomes.title: Save the Records
outcomes.desc: You prioritize the ledger-boxes and deeds—what keeps families from becoming nothing.

success.text: You pull papers from flame like they’re children. Later, people thank you with favors.

fail.text: The records burn despite you. In the ashes, someone blames you for choosing paper over people.

name: Major Event: The Returned Debt
prompt:
At forty, a debt you thought buried claws its way back up. A collector presents a note in your handwriting.

You don’t remember writing it. That doesn’t matter.

outcomes.title: Pay the Debt
outcomes.desc: You swallow pride and pay for peace.

success.text: Coin leaves your hand and some of your fear leaves with it.

fail.text: You pay and still they press. The debt was never about coin.

outcomes.title: Challenge the Note
outcomes.desc: Find a forgery, find a loophole, find a way out.

success.text: You prove the signature false. The collector leaves—grudgingly.

fail.text: You can’t crack it. The note is too good—or you’re being played by someone better.

outcomes.title: Buy Time with Threats
outcomes.desc: You make it dangerous to collect from you.

success.text: The collector steps back. Fear is a currency too.

fail.text: They’re not afraid of you. They’re afraid of whoever sent them—and that makes you small.

outcomes.title: Make Them Disappear
outcomes.desc: If the debt is a person, remove the person.

success.text: The collector doesn’t return. The debt doesn’t go away—it just changes shape.

fail.text: The attempt fails and becomes a new charge.

name: Major Event: The Sick Harvest
prompt:
A harvest sickness spreads in the villages outside **Thornmere**. The granaries smell wrong.

If you act, you might save people. If you act poorly, you might be blamed for the hunger.

outcomes.title: Quarantine the Grain
outcomes.desc: Stop distribution until it can be tested.

success.text: You hold firm. There’s anger, but fewer graves.

fail.text: People break quarantine. The sickness spreads through desperation.

outcomes.title: Find the Cause
outcomes.desc: Inspect the stores, question millers, follow the rot.

success.text: You find tainted barrels—and a supplier who knew. The lie is smaller than the hunger, but still a lie.

fail.text: You can’t find the hinge. Everyone points at everyone else and nothing changes.

outcomes.title: Hire Guards for the Granary
outcomes.desc: Keep the peace with steel.

success.text: You prevent a riot. The villagers hate you for it today and thank you for it later—maybe.

fail.text: The riot happens anyway, and you’re in the middle of it.

outcomes.title: Profit from Shortage
outcomes.desc: Buy low, sell high, and let hunger be someone else’s problem.

success.text: Your purse grows heavy. Your name grows heavy too, but in a different way.

fail.text: You’re caught with grain in your cart while children go without.

name: Major Event: The Veteran’s Lessons
prompt:
A hardened veteran offers to teach you (or your household) the ‘real’ lessons of survival: how to kill, how to endure, how to take.

At forty, you choose what kind of example you are.

outcomes.title: Train with Them
outcomes.desc: You take bruises now to avoid graves later.

success.text: You feel younger for a week. Then you feel the bruises for a month.

fail.text: You overdo it. A joint pops wrong and stays wrong.

outcomes.title: Pay for Their Loyalty
outcomes.desc: You hire them as a standing guard.

success.text: Coin turns into safety—at least until it runs out.

fail.text: You pay, and the veteran leaves anyway. Loyalty purchased is loyalty rented.

outcomes.title: Learn Their Stories
outcomes.desc: You ask what they saw, what broke them, and what they regret.

success.text: You learn how war shapes a person. The knowledge is ugly and useful.

fail.text: They shut down. Some doors are welded shut from the inside.

outcomes.title: Turn Them Away
outcomes.desc: You refuse violence as a household craft.

success.text: You choose gentler rituals. It doesn’t make the world gentler, but it makes you consistent.

fail.text: The veteran laughs and calls you naive, loudly enough for others to hear.

name: Major Event: The Merger Proposal
prompt:
At forty-five, the people who once called you ‘friend’ now call you ‘competitor.’

A proposal arrives: combine households, merge accounts, share a future. It’s safer… and it’s a trap.

outcomes.title: Agree to the Merger
outcomes.desc: You tie your fate to theirs and hope it holds.

success.text: The agreement stabilizes your position. For now, the world feels less sharp.

fail.text: The merger becomes a choke chain. You realize too late who is pulling.

outcomes.title: Read the Fine Print
outcomes.desc: You comb the proposal for the hidden blade.

success.text: You find the trap and rewrite it. They sign anyway, because they need you.

fail.text: You miss one clause. That one clause is enough.

outcomes.title: Sabotage Them First
outcomes.desc: If it’s a trap, you’d rather be the one setting it.

success.text: You leak just enough to make their position wobble. It’s cruel. It works.

fail.text: They anticipated betrayal. Now you’re the villain in a story they tell better than you do.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Prepare
outcomes.desc: You say no, then brace for retaliation.

success.text: You refuse cleanly and set your household on alert. You feel the future tightening like a bowstring.

fail.text: Retaliation comes fast. The refusal becomes a feud.

name: Major Event: The Old Enemy
prompt:
An old enemy resurfaces—someone you wronged or someone who believes you did. They arrive with witnesses.

They want satisfaction, apology, or blood. At forty-five, you don’t have the luxury of being careless.

outcomes.title: Offer a Public Apology
outcomes.desc: You kneel, speak, and hope humility is stronger than vengeance.

success.text: The apology is real. The crowd feels it. Your enemy hesitates—and that hesitation is a crack.

fail.text: They reject your apology and call it theater. The crowd laughs, and you feel the old shame return.

outcomes.title: Settle It with Steel
outcomes.desc: You accept a duel, a trial by combat, a clean ending.

success.text: You win. The enemy falls. The story ends—at least this version of it.

fail.text: You lose. The enemy doesn’t kill you, but the wound changes how you move afterward.

outcomes.title: Unmake Their Witnesses
outcomes.desc: Find what the witnesses fear and let them fear it.

success.text: The witnesses arrive less confident. Their story frays under pressure.

fail.text: Your pressure is noticed. Suddenly you look guilty—even if you aren’t.

outcomes.title: Prove Them Wrong with Records
outcomes.desc: You produce documents, dates, and names until the accusation collapses.

success.text: The accusation falls apart under facts. The enemy leaves with nothing but bitterness.

fail.text: One record contradicts another. The truth becomes muddy, and mud favors whoever shouts loudest.

name: Major Event: The Snowbound Inn
prompt:
A midwinter storm traps you and a small company in an inn on the road. Everyone is hungry. Everyone is armed.

A bag of coin goes missing.

outcomes.title: Investigate Quietly
outcomes.desc: You ask gentle questions and watch hands, not faces.

success.text: You find the thief—or you find proof enough to choose one.

fail.text: Your questions make people defensive. The inn turns colder.

outcomes.title: Impose Order
outcomes.desc: You take control of the room before the room takes control of itself.

success.text: You set rules and enforce them. The night stays tense, but it stays contained.

fail.text: Someone challenges you in front of everyone. You lose the room—and the night becomes dangerous.

outcomes.title: Steal the Blame
outcomes.desc: You point the room at someone else and let the mob do the rest.

success.text: The accusation sticks. The thief escapes into the shadows—possibly you, possibly not.

fail.text: The room realizes you manipulated them. The mood turns ugly fast.

outcomes.title: Pay Everyone Back
outcomes.desc: You cover the loss to keep peace and pride intact.

success.text: You spend coin and buy a quiet night. Sometimes that’s a victory.

fail.text: You pay and still someone accuses you. Coin can’t buy trust from people who want blood.

name: A Wolfish Invitation
prompt: In High Valewyr, invitations are weapons dressed as parchment. A sealed note finds your hand at dusk: a small supper in a side-hall of the palace, where the laughter is softer and the knives are sharper. The messenger doesn’t say your host’s name—only that you’ve been 'noticed.' In the margin, a wolf’s head is drawn in ink so fine it could be a threat or a joke.

outcomes.title: Attend With Care
outcomes.desc: Show up, say little, and listen harder than you speak.

success.text: You arrive early enough to see who arrives late on purpose. You trade pleasantries like small coins and spend them only when it buys you silence. When the supper ends, a hand lingers on your shoulder a heartbeat too long—approval, or possession. Either way, you are now inside the room where reputations are made.

fail.text: You keep your face composed, but your timing betrays you—one laugh too late, one glance too long. A few eyes mark you for later use. You leave the hall with the sense that you’ve stepped into a game whose rules you do not yet know.

outcomes.title: Arrive in Splendor
outcomes.desc: Let them see you before they decide what you are worth.

success.text: You make an entrance that forces the room to account for you. Conversation turns, then returns, but it returns differently—adjusted. Someone who matters laughs at your smallest joke. Someone who hates you decides you’re dangerous. The wolf’s head in the margin feels less like a doodle now, and more like a mark of prey and hunter both.

fail.text: Your finery draws attention, but attention is not always respect. A small comment—perfectly placed—turns your display into a story about vanity. You smile through it, yet you can feel the room’s teeth. The invitation has worked: you are a topic now.

outcomes.title: Send a Substitute
outcomes.desc: Keep yourself out of sight and learn what you can through another’s eyes.

success.text: Your proxy returns with a careful recounting of names, mannerisms, and who avoided whose gaze. It isn’t as good as being there, but it is safer, and you still come away with a thread you can pull later. In the court, absence is suspicious—yet sometimes suspicion keeps you alive.

fail.text: Your proxy is noticed. Questions are asked in the wrong tone. By morning, a rumor has already blossomed: that you fear the hall, or that you have something to hide. In places like this, either rumor can be made into an arrest.

outcomes.title: Decline Publicly
outcomes.desc: Refuse the invitation as a statement. Let them wonder why.

success.text: You refuse with calm certainty and offer no explanation. The messenger bows and leaves, but the message has been delivered all the same. Some respect you for it. Others decide they’ll bring you to heel. Either way, you’ve announced yourself to the wolves.

fail.text: Your refusal becomes entanglement. Someone counters with a 'request' framed as a courtesy you cannot decline. By the end of the day, your name has been tied to a promise you did not mean to make. In High Valewyr, a refusal can be rewritten into an obligation.

name: The Seating Ledger
prompt: The next time you step into the palace precincts, a clerk you’ve never met greets you like an old friend. Under their arm is a thin ledger—nothing official, nothing that should exist. It lists who sat beside whom, who was served first, who was made to wait. In the margins: tiny wolf heads, one beside each name that can ruin you with a smile.

outcomes.title: Buy the Ledger Quietly
outcomes.desc: Coin for ink, ink for leverage.

success.text: You pay without haggling and tuck the ledger where no honest eye will see it. The clerk’s relief is practiced—like they’ve sold the same danger before. Later, alone, you read the seating like a battlefield map. It doesn’t tell you who the wolves are. It tells you who they’ve already chosen to circle.

fail.text: You pay, but payment is a trail. Before you’ve even opened the ledger, someone else knows you have it. The clerk vanishes. A door you used to pass through without notice feels watched. Leverage is only leverage if you’re the one holding it.

outcomes.title: Memorize and Return It
outcomes.desc: Take the knowledge and leave no object to be found.

success.text: You read quickly and commit the patterns to memory—who is rising, who is being iced out, who pretends not to notice. You hand the ledger back as though it were boring. That night, you repeat names in the dark until they feel carved into your skull. No one can steal what you never carried.

fail.text: You try to swallow the ledger in a single glance, but the details slip through you like water. You give it back too quickly and the clerk looks disappointed—or relieved. You leave with only fragments: enough to make you suspicious, not enough to make you safe.

outcomes.title: Challenge the Clerk
outcomes.desc: Demand to know who pays them to keep such a book.

success.text: Your grip on their sleeve is firm enough to make the ledger tremble. The clerk hisses a name—not a person, but a place: a side-hall where laughter stays low and doors lock from the outside. You release them before you cross a line you can’t uncross, but you feel the court react, as if it has scented blood.

fail.text: You loom, and they cry out. Suddenly you are the threat, and threats in palaces are handled quickly. The ledger disappears under a dozen hands. You are escorted away with polite force and the certainty that you’ve made an enemy you can’t see.

name: Ink Between Names
prompt: You take what you’ve learned and test it against the city. In Widow’s Market, gossip is bought and sold like fish—fresh, slippery, and best consumed quickly. A washerwoman mentions a courtier’s 'new friend.' A guard complains about a sudden reassignment. The patterns from the seating ledger echo everywhere, as if the court’s hunger has spilled into the streets.

outcomes.title: Follow the Pattern
outcomes.desc: Trace the connections until you find the wolf-head at the center.

success.text: You connect three small stories into one large truth. The wolf-head marks a circle of favors exchanged in private rooms, all pointing toward a single patron with a gentle voice and brutal reach. You leave with a name you can use—or fear.

fail.text: You chase rumors until they start chasing you. By nightfall you’re not sure which whispers are true and which were planted to guide you into a trap. You get out, but you’ve spent yourself.

outcomes.title: Pay for the Truth
outcomes.desc: Slip coin where honesty won’t go.

success.text: You buy a confession in three installments: a drink, a favor, and a coin. The truth arrives as if it were nothing, and yet it changes the shape of the court in your mind. Someone important is collecting debts like trophies.

fail.text: You pay, and you receive something—but you can’t tell if it’s truth or a story crafted to waste your time. In High Valewyr, coin buys speech. It does not buy honesty.

outcomes.title: Leave No Trail
outcomes.desc: Gather what you can, then cut away clean.

success.text: You keep your hands clean—at least in public. You learn enough to avoid the worst snares and quietly adjust your own place in the city’s web. Somewhere behind you, you feel the faint pressure of attention, but it never closes.

fail.text: You cut away too late. A messenger bumps your shoulder in a crowd and smiles without warmth. You can’t prove you’re being watched, but your skin believes it. You have stepped close enough to be noticed.

name: The Smiling Rival
prompt: At the next gathering, someone approaches as if you’ve always been friends. Their smile is perfect. Their eyes are not. They offer you a compliment that doubles as a challenge and a story that sounds like a gift until you realize it has a hook buried in it. If you refuse, you will be rude. If you accept, you will be owned.

outcomes.title: Trade Compliments Like Blades
outcomes.desc: Meet them in kind. Make the room laugh at your timing.

success.text: You answer with honeyed steel. The room laughs in the right places, and the rival’s smile tightens for the first time. You don’t win the court’s love—no one wins that—but you win a moment, and moments are currency here.

fail.text: You speak, and the words almost land—almost. The rival pivots, turns your line back on you, and the laughter goes the wrong direction. You leave with your pride bruised and your name slightly less secure.

outcomes.title: Smile and Steal
outcomes.desc: Let them talk. Take what matters from the edges of their story.

success.text: You let them perform. While they do, you listen for the seams—the names they avoid, the insult tucked into a compliment. Later, you repeat one harmless detail to the right person and watch it cause quiet panic. You keep the real prize for yourself.

fail.text: You reach for the hook and it catches you instead. The rival’s story spreads with you at its center, and by the time you realize what they’ve done, the damage is already dressed as 'concern.' If someone wants you questioned, the court will oblige.

outcomes.title: Walk Away Before It Bites
outcomes.desc: Refuse the game by not playing it.

success.text: You bow, apologize with impeccable restraint, and withdraw. The rival watches you go as though tasting your absence. Later, someone quietly offers you a safer seat at the next gathering—proof that your restraint has been noticed and rewarded.

fail.text: You try to leave cleanly, but courtesy becomes a chain. A hand stops you, a request is made, and suddenly you are bound to a small promise you cannot refuse without insult. In this place, even exits can become obligations.

name: The Locked Side-Hall
prompt: You follow the whispered directions to a side-hall where the doors lock from the outside. Inside, a handful of courtiers drink as if they’re afraid of sobriety. A guard you recognize watches the door. Someone toasts you without standing. On the wall hangs a tapestry of wolves running down a stag—stitched so carefully it looks like a prophecy.

outcomes.title: Hold Your Ground
outcomes.desc: Let them test you and find you unyielding.

success.text: The first shove becomes a scuffle; the scuffle becomes a lesson. You don’t draw steel, but your body speaks clearly enough. When it’s over, you are breathing hard and standing where you began. Someone laughs—genuinely this time. You are not safe, but you are respected.

fail.text: They come at you in a knot of elbows and contempt. You land hits, but not enough. When you stumble, a boot finds your ribs. You leave the side-hall with blood in your mouth and the certainty that the wolves will try again.

outcomes.title: Turn Their Test Into a Joke
outcomes.desc: Make them laugh so they forget to bite.

success.text: You answer their cruelty with charm, turning the tension into theater. The guard’s mouth twitches as if they’re trying not to smile. By the end of the night, you’ve turned an ambush into an audience. It isn’t friendship, but it’s not blood either.

fail.text: Your joke lands wrong. The room goes quiet in the way a blade goes quiet before it strikes. Someone calls you out, and the laughter that follows is the kind that breaks things. You leave with your reputation nicked open.

outcomes.title: Slip Away With a Trophy
outcomes.desc: If they want a game, leave them poorer for playing it.

success.text: While eyes are on the insult and not the room, your fingers find what matters: a signet, a letter, a token that should not be here. You vanish before anyone can decide what you are. Outside, the night air tastes clean. In your palm, the trophy is warm with danger.

fail.text: You reach for the trophy and a hand closes around your wrist. The guard’s eyes are flat. A word is spoken, and suddenly the night is full of footsteps. If you get out, it will be as someone the palace wants to find.

name: The Public Accusation
prompt: A notice appears in the contract court—dry ink, sharp wording. Your name is included in a dispute you do not recognize, tied to obligations you never signed. The hall fills with spectators who pretend they’re only here for justice. Across the aisle, your smiling rival watches as though this is a play they’ve already seen.

outcomes.title: Produce a Counter-Record
outcomes.desc: Fight ink with ink. Force the court to acknowledge the lie.

success.text: You present the right record in the right order. The clerk’s quill slows. A murmur ripples through the benches as the lie reveals its seams. The magistrate’s face tightens; they don’t like being played. Someone important meets your gaze for the first time, not amused—interested.

fail.text: Your evidence is good, but not good enough. A signature that looks like yours is produced. A witness swears they saw you. The court does what courts do: it chooses the simplest story. Your name leaves the hall with a bruise that will show through every introduction.

outcomes.title: Turn the Crowd
outcomes.desc: If the court is theater, win the audience first.

success.text: You speak as if the court belongs to you. The spectators nod, then murmur, then lean forward, hungry for the story you’re giving them. The magistrate is forced to slow the proceedings. Someone who came to watch you fall now watches you rise—and that shift is its own kind of protection.

fail.text: Your words inflame instead of persuade. The hall turns against you, not with anger but with certainty—the certainty of a crowd that wants a villain. The magistrate lifts a hand, and guards move as if they’ve been waiting for this moment all day.

outcomes.title: Cut a Private Bargain
outcomes.desc: Find the right door, the right person, and trade something you can afford to lose.

success.text: The bargain is made in a corridor that smells of wax and old paper. You give up a small secret and receive a larger favor. The dispute dissolves into procedural fog. You walk out 'cleared,' but you can feel the price waiting in the future, patient as a wolf.

fail.text: You reach for a bargain and find only locked doors. The people who might have helped you are suddenly 'unavailable.' Someone has already paid for your isolation. The court proceeds without your consent, and you are left watching your own story be written by strangers.

name: The Wolf-Crowned Smile
prompt: Another supper. Another side-hall. This time, you are placed carefully—close enough to be seen, far enough to be contained. A cup is raised. A toast is offered to 'new understanding.' Across the table, your rival smiles as though the whole court is a jaw and you are a morsel it has decided to savor.

outcomes.title: Accept the Court’s Favor
outcomes.desc: Take the seat they offer and make it yours.

success.text: You drink. You smile. You return a toast so precise it sounds inevitable. The room relaxes—not because it trusts you, but because it understands you. You leave with a thread of favor wrapped around your wrist like a bracelet. It will tighten if you pull too hard.

fail.text: You try to take the favor without giving anything back, and the room feels it. Smiles sharpen. The toast ends too quickly. You leave with polite nods and no warmth, having failed to become what they wanted. In this place, that is noticed.

outcomes.title: Leave With Your Name Intact
outcomes.desc: Refuse to be owned. Exit while you still can.

success.text: You stand, offer a graceful excuse, and walk out before anyone can stop you without making a scene. You do not win the court. You survive it. Outside, the night air feels like a blessing. Behind you, the wolves will talk. Let them.

fail.text: You move to leave and a question hooks you in place. A promise is demanded. You refuse, and the refusal becomes a story told in the wrong tone. You get out, but you can feel a new kind of attention following your steps—curious, patient, hungry.

outcomes.title: Turn the Wolves on Each Other
outcomes.desc: If you can’t leave cleanly, leave chaos behind.

success.text: You whisper the right name into the right ear and watch the table tilt. A toast becomes an argument, an argument becomes a feud. You slip out in the noise, carrying a handful of secrets like stolen rings. The court will survive. It always does. But it will remember you as trouble.

fail.text: You try to ignite a feud and it catches you first. Someone stands; guards move; your rival’s smile finally becomes honest. You escape by speed or luck, but you leave behind a name that now fits neatly into a warrant.

name: The Ash-Pilgrim’s Road
prompt: On the Ash Road, travelers leave little piles of grey powder at the base of waystones—offerings for the dead, or wards against them. A small band of pilgrims walks ahead of you, their voices hoarse from singing. One of them coughs into their sleeve and the sound is wet. They look back as if asking you to decide what kind of person you are, here on a road that leads toward smoke and bells.

outcomes.title: Walk With Them
outcomes.desc: Share water and pace, and take their burden for a while.

success.text: You match their pace and offer what comfort you can. The singing steadies. A pilgrim tells you a story of a hospice beyond the next ridge, where candles are kept burning for anyone who arrives. When you part ways, they press ash into your palm like a blessing.

fail.text: You stay with them, but the cough worsens. The night is cold and shared breaths are close. By morning your throat aches and your limbs feel heavy. The pilgrims thank you anyway, because kindness doesn’t stop sickness—only proves you were willing to try.

outcomes.title: Keep Your Distance
outcomes.desc: Offer coin or supplies, but don’t share the air.

success.text: You keep a respectful distance and still help—water left where they can take it, coin pressed into the hand of their leader. They nod with tired gratitude. You avoid the worst risk and still earn a quiet kind of respect: the kind reserved for those who help without needing to be seen doing it.

fail.text: Your caution reads like cruelty. One pilgrim spits in the dust and calls you a coward. The word sticks to you longer than it should. Even if you were right, the road remembers the shape of your choices.

outcomes.title: Take Their Map
outcomes.desc: If they’re headed for trouble, at least leave with something useful.

success.text: A satchel strap slips, a folded map changes hands, and no one notices until you’re already walking away. The map is marked with hospice signs, guarded gates, and a shortcut that avoids the worst marshes. It’s practical knowledge—and practical knowledge often looks like theft.

fail.text: Your fingers are quick, but not quick enough. A pilgrim’s shout draws eyes. The road is wide, but blame travels fast. You escape, yet you can feel the future narrowing: gates, questions, hands on hilts when you approach.

name: The Quarantine Gate
prompt: A gatehouse blocks the road, its timbers stained with smoke. A bell rope hangs within reach, and someone has tied grey ribbons to it—warnings, prayers, or both. A tired watch captain calls out: beyond the gate, a sickness has taken hold. Travelers may pass only if they submit to inspection and a night in the wardhouse. You can see the wardhouse windows: candlelight, shadows, coughing.

outcomes.title: Submit to the Wardhouse
outcomes.desc: Take the night. Take the risk. Keep your name clean.

success.text: You endure the wardhouse: damp straw, harsh vinegar, and the steady sound of breathing that might not last. You help where you can and keep your fear in your chest. By morning, the captain nods and lets you through. Your patience has bought you passage—and a few quiet allies among the weary.

fail.text: You spend the night behind shuttered windows. The wardhouse air is thick with sickness and old smoke. By dawn, your joints ache and your skin is hot. The captain still lets you through—rules are rules—but you cross the threshold carrying more than your pack.

outcomes.title: Bribe for a Pass-Slip
outcomes.desc: Coin speaks well at tired gates.

success.text: You press coin into the captain’s palm, and the captain pretends it fell there by accident. A pass-slip is written with a flourish that says 'official' to anyone who doesn’t look too closely. You pass without the wardhouse’s air in your lungs, but the captain’s eyes linger as if measuring future leverage.

fail.text: You offer coin and receive contempt. The captain’s voice rises; the gatehouse turns to look. Bribes are only bribes if the other party wants them. You’re turned back for the night and made an example of. Tomorrow, you’ll be remembered.

outcomes.title: Slip Past After Dark
outcomes.desc: Wait for the bell to go quiet and the watch to doze.

success.text: You find the loose board and the blind angle and move like a rumor. The gatehouse bell never rings. On the far side, the road feels narrower, as if the land itself resents your trespass. Still—you are through, and you’ve learned something about how rules can be stepped around.

fail.text: A lantern swings. A shout follows. You run, but the sound of boots on planks is close. When you finally lose them, you are on the wrong side of the law and the wrong side of the gate. The road ahead will be worse for you now.

name: Night in the Ward
prompt: The wardhouse is a low building that smells of smoke, vinegar, and fear. A keeper with ash-grey hands shows you where to sit and what not to touch. The sick lie under thin blankets; the healthy pretend not to watch. Somewhere in the dark, a child calls for water. The keeper meets your gaze and says, softly: 'If you’re here, you’re part of it.'

outcomes.title: Keep Vigil
outcomes.desc: Stay awake. Help the keeper. Learn what the ward teaches.

success.text: You keep vigil until your eyes burn. You carry water, wash cloths, and speak gently when the night becomes too loud. In the small hours, the keeper shows you a ritual of ash and breath that calms panic even when it cannot cure. When dawn comes, you feel older in a way that matters.

fail.text: You try to help, but your hands shake and your patience frays. You snap at someone who didn’t deserve it. The keeper doesn’t scold you—just watches, disappointed, as if they’ve seen this collapse a hundred times. You leave the wardhouse with a weight you can’t name.

outcomes.title: Study the Signs
outcomes.desc: Look for causes, patterns, and what the keepers won’t say aloud.

success.text: You notice the timing of the coughs, the smell of the water, the way certain blankets are set aside. It isn’t proof, but it’s enough to form a theory—enough to warn someone later, or to save yourself. Knowledge doesn’t cure, but it changes how you move through danger.

fail.text: You lean too close and breathe the wrong air. Your questions go unanswered, and by morning your throat is raw. Whatever the wardhouse holds, it has taken something from you now.

name: The Brass Stamp
prompt: The pass-slip gets you through the gate, but it also paints a target. In a roadside tavern, a petty official with a brass stamp and too-clean hands asks to see your papers. Their smile is practiced; their questions are not. You can feel the moment turning, like a wheel about to slip its rut.

outcomes.title: Talk Them Into Looking Away
outcomes.desc: Make it sound like compliance was always the plan.

success.text: You speak with calm certainty and give them something small to hold onto: a plausible story, a respectable name, a sense that their authority has been honored. The brass stamp remains unused. You leave before they can reconsider.

fail.text: Your story stumbles. The official’s smile widens. They stamp your papers anyway—hard enough to tear the edge. When you leave, you feel marked by more than ink: by scrutiny.

outcomes.title: Pay Again
outcomes.desc: Make the problem disappear with the oldest solution.

success.text: Coin changes the official’s priorities. The brass stamp becomes a toy they no longer care to use. You leave poorer but unchallenged, and your pack feels lighter in more ways than one.

fail.text: You offer coin and they call for the watch. Some people want power more than money, and you’ve just admitted you have something to hide. The room turns cold around you.

name: Smoke in the Reeds
prompt: You slip past the gate in darkness, but the road ahead is not empty. In the wetlands beyond, smoke drifts low over the reeds—cooking fires, or something burned to keep it from spreading. You hear coughing in the distance and the soft clang of a bell. The shortcut you took has put you where no one is supposed to be.

outcomes.title: Find the Hidden Camp
outcomes.desc: Move toward the smoke and learn what was kept outside the gate.

success.text: You find a hidden camp: travelers turned away, sick and frightened, surviving on scraps. They tell you what the gatehouse didn’t—how long the sickness has been here, and what the officials are afraid to admit. You leave with hard truths and ash on your boots.

fail.text: The reeds swallow you. The smoke stings your eyes and your lungs. You stumble into a patch of stagnant air and cough until you taste iron. When you finally find your way out, you’ve learned nothing but the shape of your own vulnerability.

outcomes.title: Turn Back to the Main Road
outcomes.desc: Enough. Survive first, understand later.

success.text: You swallow your curiosity and retreat before the night can claim you. By dawn you’re back on the main road, dusty and alive. Turning back isn’t glory, but it is wisdom. You keep your breath and your blood, and that counts for more than stories.

fail.text: You turn back too late. A patrol catches your tracks and follows them like hounds. You get away, but not cleanly. The gatehouse bell may not have rung, yet the law has found you anyway.

name: The Candle Rite
prompt: At last you reach the hospice chapel: a small stone hall where candles burn even in daylight. The keepers ask travelers to leave a pinch of ash at the threshold and speak a name for the dead. Some cry. Some stare. The smoke carries every word upward. A keeper offers you a candle and says: 'One light for what you’ve lost. One for what you fear to lose.'

outcomes.title: Light Both Candles
outcomes.desc: Let the ritual touch you. Let it change you.

success.text: You speak names you didn’t know you were carrying. The smoke takes them without judgment. When you leave, the road feels quieter—not safer, just quieter. You have done what the keepers asked: you have made room for grief without letting it own you.

fail.text: You try, but the words catch. Your candle sputters, stubborn as a secret. Still, you stand in the smoke and hold the flame until it steadies. It isn’t peace, but it’s a start. You leave with ash under your nails and a little more honesty in your chest.

outcomes.title: Offer Coin to the Keepers
outcomes.desc: Support the work. Let charity be your ritual.

success.text: You place coin in the keeper’s bowl and feel the weight of it leave you. The keepers don’t thank you with fanfare—only with a nod that says you have contributed to something that will outlast you. A small favor is offered in return: guidance, shelter, a quiet word at the next gate.

fail.text: You give what you can, but it isn’t enough to change much. The bowl stays heavy in the keeper’s hands. Still, coin given in hard times is rarely wasted. You leave with no new favors—only the knowledge that you tried.

outcomes.title: Keep Your Candle Unlit
outcomes.desc: Refuse the ritual. Don’t let smoke tell you what to feel.

success.text: You hold the unlit candle and say nothing. The keepers do not force you. Outside, the wind is cold and honest. You leave with your feelings intact—untouched, untransformed. That has its own cost, but it is one you choose.

fail.text: You refuse, and someone notices. A keeper watches you with a quiet sadness that feels like judgment. Later, on the road, a traveler whispers about those who won’t speak names to the smoke. Superstition clings like soot, even if you don’t believe it.

name: Collector’s Knock
prompt:
In Marrowgate’s shadowed arcade, a man with a neat ledger finds you. Two quiet companions stand close enough to make their meaning plain.

“Accounts,” he says. “We settle them today.”

outcomes.title: Pay in Coin
outcomes.desc: You swallow pride and pay what you can, now, before the crowd notices.

success.text: You count the coins into his palm. He nods once—no warmth, no malice—and vanishes into the market’s churn.

fail.text: You fumble, argue, and draw eyes. The collector takes what you offer and leaves you with the taste of ridicule.

outcomes.title: Renegotiate Terms
outcomes.desc: You argue the ledger, the dates, the witnesses—make it sound like they’ve erred.

success.text: You find a crack in the ink and press until it widens. The collector’s jaw tightens, then he scratches a new line: lesser terms… for now.

fail.text: He smiles as you speak. When you finish, he taps the page where your name sits, unchanging, and the smile becomes pity.

outcomes.title: Offer a Service
outcomes.desc: You trade labor and discretion for time—an ugly bargain dressed as courtesy.

success.text: You leave with a task, not a bruised purse. The collector’s people stop following—for the moment.

fail.text: You offer too much, too eagerly. The collector smells desperation and raises the terms with a shrug.

outcomes.title: Drive Them Off
outcomes.desc: You make it clear you won’t be tallied like a crate of saltfish.

success.text: The collector backs away first. He does not run—but his eyes promise you’ll be written into a different ledger.

fail.text: You lunge. They’re quicker than they look. Pain blooms, and the market learns your name for the wrong reason.

name: Seizure Notice
prompt:
A wax-sealed notice is pressed into your hand at Kestrelbank: goods and wages, present and future, are named as collateral.

It is written politely. That makes it worse.

outcomes.title: Sell Something Dear
outcomes.desc: You part with an heirloom, a weapon, a ring—something you told yourself you’d keep.

success.text: You make the sale and feel lighter in the purse and heavier in the chest. The notice is satisfied—on paper, at least.

fail.text: You find no buyer worth trusting. The best offers smell of theft and laughter.

outcomes.title: Hide Your Assets
outcomes.desc: You move coin and goods where ledgers cannot reach.

success.text: Your wealth becomes smoke—present, but hard to grasp. The seizure comes up short.

fail.text: A watcher sees too much. By nightfall, your hiding place is already known.

outcomes.title: Appeal to a Patron
outcomes.desc: You ask someone important to vouch for you—publicly, painfully.

success.text: A signature joins your name. The notice is amended, softened, delayed. You owe a new debt now—one without numbers.

fail.text: No one answers. Or they answer with silence. The notice remains, and so does the stinging knowledge of where you stand.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Seizure
outcomes.desc: You tear the notice and dare them to enforce it.

success.text: The paper shreds. So does your place in polite order. You keep what’s yours—for now.

fail.text: Hands seize you first. The notice is read aloud. Your cheeks burn hotter than your wrists.

name: A Desperate Commission
prompt:
In Briarwatch, a messenger offers quick coin for a quick errand—no questions, no witnesses, no delays.

The sort of work that makes honest folk look away.

outcomes.title: Do the Work Clean
outcomes.desc: You keep your hands as clean as the job allows.

success.text: You deliver the parcel and keep your eyes forward. The coin is real. The relief is, too.

fail.text: You hesitate at the wrong moment. The parcel is taken from you, and you are left with only suspicion.

outcomes.title: Cut Corners
outcomes.desc: You take the faster road and trust luck to cover the rest.

success.text: You arrive early and unseen. The pay is smaller than promised—but enough to breathe.

fail.text: You arrive early—straight into a patrol. The parcel becomes evidence in someone else’s story.

outcomes.title: Take a Second Cut
outcomes.desc: If the job is dirty, you may as well profit twice.

success.text: You skim what you can and leave no obvious sign. The coin weight in your pocket is almost comforting.

fail.text: Someone notices the missing weight. The messenger’s smile turns thin. This will not be forgiven.

outcomes.title: Refuse and Beg Time
outcomes.desc: You try to talk your way into mercy instead of money.

success.text: You leave with no coin—but with a promised delay. It is not kindness. It is calculation.

fail.text: No one buys your sob story. Your refusal is noted, and the note will travel.

name: Contract Court
prompt:
You are summoned to a low hall where ink rules more cruelly than steel. A clerk reads your debt as if it were a prayer.

The room waits to see whether you kneel or bite.

outcomes.title: Speak Plainly
outcomes.desc: You admit what you must and ask for terms you can survive.

success.text: You leave with a schedule instead of a sentence. It will still hurt—but it is bearable.

fail.text: Plain speech becomes plain weakness. The clerk writes harsher terms without looking you in the eye.

outcomes.title: Find a Flaw
outcomes.desc: You hunt for a technicality—some missing seal, some wrong date.

success.text: A missing witness mark saves you. The clerk hisses through his teeth as he alters the record.

fail.text: You argue like a lawyer and lose like a peasant. The room laughs softly.

outcomes.title: Bribe the Clerk
outcomes.desc: You grease the ink and hope the ink remembers you kindly.

success.text: The clerk pockets your offering and stamps a new copy. Your debt shrinks… and your shame grows.

fail.text: He takes your coin and calls for the bailiff. You learn how quickly a quiet hall can become a cage.

outcomes.title: Make a Scene
outcomes.desc: You turn the hall’s attention into a weapon.

success.text: Your voice carries. The hall shifts. For once, the clerk looks uncertain. You win time with sheer force of presence.

fail.text: Hands seize you. Inksplattered shame follows. The record grows darker, not lighter.

name: Flee the Ledger
prompt:
At Gloambridge, fog hangs like a curtain and the road beyond feels like forgetting. You could leave your debt behind.

It will not stay forgotten. But it might take time to catch you.

outcomes.title: Slip Away Quietly
outcomes.desc: You leave before dawn, taking only what you can carry.

success.text: You are a rumor by midday. The ledger cannot chase what it cannot name—yet.

fail.text: You are stopped on the road and asked questions you cannot answer cleanly.

outcomes.title: Buy a New Name
outcomes.desc: You pay for false papers and the mercy of strangers.

success.text: Ink becomes armor. Your old name remains on the ledger; your new one walks free.

fail.text: The papers are flawed. The first person who reads them reads you, too.

outcomes.title: Face It Instead
outcomes.desc: You stay. You endure the shame. You try to build back from within the rules.

success.text: You swallow the bitter thing and do not choke. The road remains open—if narrower than before.

fail.text: You stay, and the city stays hungry. It takes what it can from you and calls it order.

outcomes.title: Burn the Record
outcomes.desc: You aim to destroy the ledger itself.

success.text: Fire eats ink. For a heartbeat, you feel clean. Then you realize what else fire might have woken.

fail.text: You reach for the ledger and find a knife instead. Pain is immediate. Consequences are worse.

name: The Rumor Mill
prompt:
You hear your own name spoken with a laugh that stops when you look over. Rumors run ahead of you in Marrowgate like rats.

If you do nothing, they will breed.

outcomes.title: Apologize in Public
outcomes.desc: You make a show of humility before the right eyes.

success.text: You bow, you speak, you swallow pride. The crowd finds it hard to hate someone who bleeds so openly.

fail.text: Your apology sounds rehearsed. People do not forgive performances; they forgive wounds.

outcomes.title: Plant a Better Story
outcomes.desc: You feed the gossips something tastier than the truth.

success.text: By dusk, the tale has changed. Not cleaner—just pointed elsewhere.

fail.text: Someone catches the seam in your lie and tugs until it unravels.

outcomes.title: Endure in Silence
outcomes.desc: You keep your chin up and let time do its slow work.

success.text: You do not flinch. Some admire that. Most simply tire of watching you suffer.

fail.text: Silence is mistaken for guilt. The whispers grow bolder.

outcomes.title: Pick a Fight
outcomes.desc: You choose one loudmouth and make an example.

success.text: The room goes quiet. Fear can look like respect from the right angle.

fail.text: You swing and miss. Someone else lands the real blow—on your reputation.

name: Notice of Hearing
prompt:
A formal notice arrives: you are invited—no, required—to appear and answer for yourself.

The ink is crisp. The judgment behind it is already half-written.

outcomes.title: Show Contrition
outcomes.desc: You give them a penitent face and a careful story.

success.text: You speak of regret without begging for love. The hall, grudgingly, accepts the shape of your remorse.

fail.text: Your contrition sounds like self-pity. The hall grows cold.

outcomes.title: Bring Evidence
outcomes.desc: You come armed with dates, witnesses, and inconvenient facts.

success.text: Ink fights ink. For once, yours holds. The clerk’s eyebrows rise, and the whispers lose their certainty.

fail.text: Your evidence is dismissed as cleverness. Cleverness is not the same as innocence—at least not here.

outcomes.title: Buy a Witness
outcomes.desc: You pay for someone to remember things differently.

success.text: The witness speaks with trembling conviction. The hall nods along, pleased to be told what it wants to hear.

fail.text: The witness cracks. Under questions, the paid words spill into a confession that drags you with it.

outcomes.title: Refuse the Hearing
outcomes.desc: You do not appear. Let them judge an empty chair.

success.text: You walk away before they can cage you in ceremony. The city will call it guilt. You call it survival.

fail.text: They find you anyway. Refusal becomes an additional charge, and the charge becomes a chain.

name: Service in Shadows
prompt:
A small hospice on the Verdant Road takes in the unwanted. No one asks your name—only what your hands can do.

Work won’t cleanse you, but it can change what people remember.

outcomes.title: Do the Hard Work
outcomes.desc: You scrub floors, carry water, and accept every unglamorous task.

success.text: Day by day, the stain dulls. A few travelers leave speaking of your steadiness instead of your shame.

fail.text: You try, but pride keeps finding your hands. Someone notices and shakes their head.

outcomes.title: Tend the Sick
outcomes.desc: You learn what hurts others, and hope it teaches you what hurt you caused.

success.text: You speak softly, work carefully, and earn quiet gratitude. No one calls you saint—but they stop calling you villain.

fail.text: You make a mistake. It isn’t cruel—only careless—but careless ruins lives too.

outcomes.title: Make a Quiet Donation
outcomes.desc: You buy goodwill the way the powerful do: without asking permission.

success.text: Coin changes hands; so does narrative. The hospice speaks well of you, and the road carries that kindness outward.

fail.text: Your gift is taken as hush money. The worst interpretations bloom like mold.

outcomes.title: Steal a Little Peace
outcomes.desc: If the world won’t give you grace, you’ll take something else.

success.text: You skim what you can without harming the sick. The hospice never notices. Your conscience does.

fail.text: Caught. The word spreads faster than your shame ever did—because people love to be proven right.

name: Duel of Repute
prompt:
A rival offers you a choice: accept a formal duel—of steel or of words—or be remembered forever as the one who declined.

Sometimes redemption is just risk with better clothing.

outcomes.title: Duel with Steel
outcomes.desc: You meet them blade-to-blade where everyone can see.

success.text: You win cleanly and stop short of cruelty. The crowd exhales; the story changes in its telling.

fail.text: You lose, and the world treats it like proof. Pain is temporary. The laughter lingers.

outcomes.title: Duel with Words
outcomes.desc: You let wit and composure do what your blade cannot.

success.text: You turn their accusations into their own embarrassment. Some applause is genuine. That matters.

fail.text: You stumble on a phrase and they pounce. The hall laughs again, and you feel the stain deepen.

outcomes.title: Fight Dirty
outcomes.desc: You win by any means that ends the conversation.

success.text: A whispered truth, a hidden blade, a sudden shove—whatever it was, it worked. The duel ends. So does your last excuse.

fail.text: Your trick fails. Now you’re not only shamed—you’re caught.

outcomes.title: Decline and Leave
outcomes.desc: You refuse the stage and take your chances elsewhere.

success.text: You walk away from the crowd’s hunger. The stain doesn’t vanish—but it stops growing.

fail.text: They spit after you. The story hardens. You can feel doors closing.

name: Rite of Atonement
prompt:
In a small roadside chapel, an elder offers a ritual meant for the shamed: a public confession, a private penance, or a gift to those you wronged.

It will not erase the past. But it might soften its teeth.

outcomes.title: Confess Publicly
outcomes.desc: You speak your faults aloud where gossip can’t twist them further.

success.text: You confess without theater. The room grows quiet, then oddly gentle. The stain doesn’t vanish—but it fades.

fail.text: Your confession turns into justification. The elder’s face hardens. You leave feeling worse than when you arrived.

outcomes.title: Take Private Penance
outcomes.desc: You do the work without the spectacle: fasting, labor, and silence.

success.text: A week passes with sore hands and calmer thoughts. When you return to the road, you stand straighter.

fail.text: You try to endure, but you break early. You learn that quitting hurts twice: once in body, once in story.

outcomes.title: Buy Reparations
outcomes.desc: You pay what you can to those harmed by your name.

success.text: Coin cannot mend everything. But it can mend enough that some people stop wishing you ill.

fail.text: Your reparations are taken as mockery—too little, too late, too convenient. The road carries the insult onward.

outcomes.title: Forge a Cleansing Story
outcomes.desc: You invent a narrative so pious it becomes hard to question.

success.text: The tale spreads: tragedy, misunderstanding, cruel rivals. People love a simple story. You give them one.

fail.text: Someone from your past is in the chapel and hears every word. Their laughter is quiet—and devastating.

name: Misstep on Wet Stones
prompt:
Rain slicks the old stones. One careless step sends you down hard.

You can walk—but every movement reminds you of the lesson.

outcomes.title: Laugh It Off
outcomes.desc: You rise quickly and keep moving, pretending it didn’t hurt.

success.text: You grit your teeth and carry on. Pride holds you upright.

fail.text: You push too hard and feel something wrench. The ache deepens into something worse.

outcomes.title: Bind It Properly
outcomes.desc: You take the time to wrap and brace before you travel.

success.text: A careful binding keeps the worst of the pain at bay. You move slower, but safer.

fail.text: Your wrapping slips, and you spend the day fighting it. Fatigue settles into your bones.

outcomes.title: Find a Handhold
outcomes.desc: You look for a safer route and a steadier footing.

success.text: You take the long way and avoid a worse fall. Still, you don’t escape entirely unmarked.

fail.text: You misjudge the detour and lose time and supplies to the mud.

outcomes.title: Leap the Gap
outcomes.desc: You choose speed over sense.

success.text: You clear it with a jolt of pain and a grin you don’t quite mean.

fail.text: Your foot slips at the edge. You hit the stone like a bell struck too hard.

name: Sparring Mishap
prompt:
A friendly spar turns sharp. A wooden blade catches you in the wrong place, and the room goes quiet for a heartbeat.

It’s not deadly—just… memorable.

outcomes.title: Shake It Out
outcomes.desc: You insist you’re fine and demand they continue.

success.text: You force your body to obey. The lesson is learned in pain.

fail.text: You overextend and something tears. Pride turns into regret.

outcomes.title: Take the Lesson
outcomes.desc: You step back, breathe, and let the spar end with dignity.

success.text: You swallow embarrassment and keep your body intact.

fail.text: Your restraint is taken as weakness. The jeers sting worse than the bruise.

outcomes.title: Study the Footwork
outcomes.desc: You watch instead of swing—learn what you can without risking more pain.

success.text: You learn a thing or two while your body recovers.

fail.text: You miss the rhythm of the bout. The lesson slips away.

outcomes.title: Cheat a Little
outcomes.desc: A hidden shove, a tripped foot—nothing a crowd can swear to.

success.text: You ‘win’ and keep face. The bruise still blooms beneath your sleeve.

fail.text: Caught. The spar ends in real anger.

name: Herbal Poultice
prompt:
A hedge-healer offers a poultice that smells like crushed leaves and bitter sap.

“It won’t make you young,” she says. “But it might make you steady.”

outcomes.title: Pay for the Poultice
outcomes.desc: Coin is easier to spend than patience.

success.text: The poultice burns, then cools. By morning, the ache has backed away.

fail.text: You pay and still fumble the care. The poultice helps—but not enough.

outcomes.title: Brew It Yourself
outcomes.desc: You trust your own hands more than hers.

success.text: You mix the herbs with careful intent. The pain loosens its grip.

fail.text: You misjudge the mixture. The skin reddens and your temper follows.

outcomes.title: Endure Without Help
outcomes.desc: You let the bruise run its course.

success.text: You rest when you can and push only when you must. The bruise fades on its own time.

fail.text: You push when you should rest. The ache sharpens into a true injury.

outcomes.title: Hide the Pain
outcomes.desc: You mask it with posture, charm, and a careful sleeve.

success.text: No one notices, and that is a kind of victory. The bruise remains, but it stops ruling you.

fail.text: Someone notices anyway. The pity in their eyes is worse than the pain.

name: Sheltered Rest
prompt: A warm inn and a clean pallet are offered—at a price. Rest is its own resource, and you are running low.

outcomes.title: Pay for a Night’s Rest
outcomes.desc: You buy comfort and a little time.

success.text: A night of sleep does what heroics cannot. You wake steadier.

fail.text: You pay, but the room is noisy and the mattress lumpy. Rest comes in scraps.

outcomes.title: Barter Work for Bed
outcomes.desc: You sweep, chop, or scrub in exchange for shelter.

success.text: You earn your rest honestly. The pain fades with the dawn.

fail.text: You work until you shake, and the bruise remains stubborn as a curse.

outcomes.title: Sleep Outside
outcomes.desc: You save coin and pay in discomfort.

success.text: It isn’t pleasant, but it’s enough. The bruise loosens.

fail.text: Cold seeps into your bones. You wake worse than you lay down.

outcomes.title: Pick a Fight for Pride
outcomes.desc: You refuse to look weak—especially to strangers.

success.text: You win a brief scuffle and keep face. The bruise remains, but fear gives you a little room to breathe.

fail.text: The fight turns uglier than you meant. You limp away with something worse than a bruise.

name: Cough in the Candlelight
prompt: At a warm hall-table in Greenfold, laughter rises with the smoke. Then someone coughs—once, twice—wet and ugly. By morning, half the servants look gray, and the lord's steward keeps a cloth over his mouth like it could stop fate.

outcomes.title: Stay and Play It Strong
outcomes.desc: Keep appearances. If you look afraid, the rumor will eat you before any fever does.

success.text: You remain all poise and quiet authority, speaking only when necessary. People follow your lead, and panic never quite catches. If sickness comes, it comes late—and your composure is remembered.

fail.text: You force yourself to stay, to smile through the stink of smoke and sickness. The next day your throat burns and your joints ache. The hall remembers you as 'brave'—and you remember it as 'stupid'.

outcomes.title: Slip Out Before Dawn
outcomes.desc: Leave quietly, while the doors still open and names aren't being taken.

success.text: You vanish in the hour when even guards are tired. Later you hear who fell ill—and who denied it. You keep a small, sharp truth that may matter when the hall rewrites its story.

fail.text: A servant sees you go and whispers to the wrong ear. By noon, your absence has a shape: 'cowardice'. It's not deadly, but it stains.

outcomes.title: Offer Practical Help
outcomes.desc: If it spreads, contain it—water boiled, cloths changed, beds separated.

success.text: You organize hands and habits. When the worst passes, people speak of you in the same breath as 'sense'. It's a thin kind of glory, but real.

fail.text: You try to help, and still you touch the wrong cup, breathe the wrong air. The work is honest, but the fever doesn't care.

name: Fogwater Ford
prompt: The ford is shallow, but the fog is thick and the water bites like teeth. By the far bank, your boots are stones and your breath comes out wrong.

outcomes.title: Cross Fast, Don't Think
outcomes.desc: Get through before your courage has time to argue.

success.text: You grit your teeth and keep moving. Cold becomes a thing behind you. Later, someone calls you hard as iron.

fail.text: Your foot slips; you go down hard and swallow river-water. You get up, but the cough stays with you like a debt.

outcomes.title: Find a Higher Crossing
outcomes.desc: Lose time now to avoid paying for it later.

success.text: You trace the fog's edge until you find stones set like a half-remembered path. It costs time, but you keep your health—and even spot a patch of winter herbs.

fail.text: You wander too long. The cold creeps into your bones anyway, and by the time you cross you're tired in the marrow.

outcomes.title: Make Camp and Warm Up
outcomes.desc: Stop. Build a small fire. Let your body forgive you.

success.text: The fire is miserable and small, but it is enough. You cross later with steady breath.

fail.text: The wood is wet and your patience isn't. You burn supplies and time and still feel the cold in your joints.

name: Physicker’s Bitter Draft
prompt: In a back lane that smells of crushed herbs and old wine, a physicker offers you a cup the color of swampwater. "It will help," she says. "Or it will teach you what help costs."

outcomes.title: Pay for Proper Care
outcomes.desc: Clean linens, heated stones, and bitter medicine—no shortcuts.

success.text: Coin buys time, warmth, and someone to change the cloth before it turns. The fever breaks in a single night, leaving you weak but alive.

fail.text: You pay, and still the physicker shrugs. "Bodies are stubborn," she says. "So are stories." You leave lighter in purse and only slightly steadier in breath.

outcomes.title: Endure the Folk Remedy
outcomes.desc: A poultice of garlic and ash, and a lot of faith.

success.text: It tastes like regret, but you swallow it anyway. The fever loosens its grip, and your lungs remember how to be lungs.

fail.text: You sweat through the night, drifting in and out of ugly dreams. When you wake, you are not worse—but you're not better either.

outcomes.title: Trade a Favor for the Cure
outcomes.desc: You offer a secret, a debt, a promise—anything that isn't coin.

success.text: You speak softly and pay in a different currency. The physicker nods once, and the next draught she hands you is the real thing.

fail.text: You offer leverage and get laughed out of the lane. Illness doesn't respect negotiation.

name: Borrowed Bed
prompt: A roadside widow keeps a spare cot in her loft. It's clean enough. It's warm. It's also watched by a neighbor who loves other people's business.

outcomes.title: Pay for a Night’s Rest
outcomes.desc: Sleep with your boots off. Let the world keep turning without you.

success.text: You sleep like stone and wake like a person again. The widow asks nothing more than the coin and a quiet goodbye.

fail.text: You pay, but sleep doesn't come. Every creak sounds like a threat; every shadow is a hand. You leave less tired in body, perhaps, but not in spirit.

outcomes.title: Work for the Cot
outcomes.desc: Split wood, fix a hinge, carry water. Earn the right to be still.

success.text: You work until your hands sting, and then you sleep. The widow tells her neighbor you were 'respectable', which is its own kind of armor.

fail.text: You slip on a wet plank and bang your shoulder hard. The widow still lets you sleep, but pain shares the cot.

outcomes.title: Move On
outcomes.desc: Better tired than tangled in someone else’s rumors.

success.text: You keep walking. You also keep your name clean. Along the way you hear a scrap of talk worth remembering.

fail.text: You keep walking until the stars blur. By morning, your legs are treason.

name: Three Sleepless Nights
prompt: Your mind won't close. Every time you blink, a new worry opens its mouth. On the third night you start seeing patterns in smoke that aren't there.

outcomes.title: Write It All Down
outcomes.desc: If the thoughts won't stop, trap them on parchment.

success.text: You bleed your anxieties into ink. By dawn, the page holds them, and your mind is quieter. Also: one of those worries was true.

fail.text: You write until your hand cramps, but the thoughts keep coming. When you finally sleep, it's shallow and mean.

outcomes.title: Drink to Forget
outcomes.desc: A mug. Then another. Let the world go soft at the edges.

success.text: The drink drags you down into a thick, dreamless night. You wake groggy, but you did wake. Someone saw you, though.

fail.text: You drink and drink and still the thoughts gnaw. In the morning, you have a headache and a reputation.

outcomes.title: Force Discipline
outcomes.desc: Breathe. Count. Reset the mind like a blade honed on stone.

success.text: You wrestle your thoughts into order. It is not peace, but it is control. When you finally sleep, it is earned.

fail.text: You strain until your jaw aches and your eyes burn. The stress breaks something small inside you.

name: Wrong Face at the Gate
prompt: A watchman squints at you under the gatehouse lantern. "Hold," he says. "I know that face." His hand drifts toward the bell-rope.

outcomes.title: Talk Your Way Past
outcomes.desc: Make your voice sound like it belongs here.

success.text: You smile, you nod, you speak the right names. The watchman hesitates—and lets you through. Not because he believes you, but because he prefers quiet.

fail.text: You say one name wrong. The lantern light hardens. "That's him," someone says, and suddenly the bell-rope is an accusation.

outcomes.title: Slip Away Into the Crowd
outcomes.desc: Become a different person for a few heartbeats.

success.text: You melt into moving bodies, a cloak among cloaks. Later you learn whose face you were wearing, and why that was dangerous.

fail.text: A child points. A dog barks. The watchman shouts. You run, and the running becomes your name.

outcomes.title: Push Through
outcomes.desc: If you hesitate, you're caught. If you don't, maybe you're bold enough to be innocent.

success.text: You shoulder past the watchman and hit the street like a thrown stone. For a moment you are unstoppable. Then the city starts to chase.

fail.text: You hit the gate like a bull and pay for it like a man. The watchman's cudgel finds your ribs, and the bell finds your name.

name: False Papers, True Ink
prompt: A scrivener with ink-stained fingers offers a new name—written clean, sealed well, and just plausible enough to fool a tired guard.

outcomes.title: Pay for the Papers
outcomes.desc: A name with no past is still expensive.

success.text: You walk out with a new name in your pocket and an old one buried under lies. It isn’t honorable, but it is breathable.

fail.text: The seal is wrong; the ink smears. The scrivener shrugs and vanishes into the alley. You're still you, and the world still wants you.

outcomes.title: Threaten the Scrivener
outcomes.desc: If you can't afford lies, take them.

success.text: You make your meaning clear. The scrivener’s hands shake as he writes, but the work is good. You leave with papers—and a stain.

fail.text: You reach for the scrivener and find a knife instead. He slips away bleeding, and your name gets sharper in the telling.

outcomes.title: Trade a Secret
outcomes.desc: Give him something he can sell later.

success.text: You whisper a truth that shouldn't have an audience. The scrivener smiles like a merchant and hands you your new life.

fail.text: You offer a secret and get measured for its value. The scrivener decides you are worth more hunted than helped.

name: Bounty Hunters Close In
prompt: You feel them before you see them: the quiet absence of casual conversation, the way doors close one breath too early. Then, on a narrow road, three riders appear behind you—patient as debt.

outcomes.title: Lose Them in the Brush
outcomes.desc: Take the hard ground and make it your ally.

success.text: You disappear into thorns and wet earth, emerging later scraped but free. The riders pass you by, cursing the road. You keep the knowledge of how close you were to the end.

fail.text: A branch catches your cloak; a horse catches your shadow. You escape, but not cleanly.

outcomes.title: Buy Them Off
outcomes.desc: Gold is louder than justice when no one is watching.

success.text: You meet them on the road and speak like a man who can pay. They agree—because they were never there for honor in the first place.

fail.text: Your coin is counted and found wanting. They take it anyway, and now they also take your time.

outcomes.title: Turn and Fight
outcomes.desc: If you run, you die tired. Better to die loud.

success.text: You break one rider and send another limping. The third decides you are too expensive to claim. Your name grows larger—dangerous, but real.

fail.text: Steel meets steel, and your body remembers it is made of meat. You live, but you pay.

name: Forage in the Greenfold
prompt: Your stomach makes arguments your pride can't answer. The Greenfold’s hedgerows are thick with life—some of it edible, some of it eager to punish the ignorant.

outcomes.title: Forage Carefully
outcomes.desc: Take only what you can name. Leave the rest for the crows.

success.text: You find bitter roots and a handful of nuts, enough to silence the worst of the hunger. It isn't a feast, but it keeps the road from winning.

fail.text: You eat what looks safe and regret it within the hour. Your belly knots and your throat goes raw.

outcomes.title: Set a Snare
outcomes.desc: If you're patient, the forest will pay you back.

success.text: At dusk you return to find a fat rabbit in the loop. Hunger quiets. Unfortunately, the snare line belongs to someone with opinions.

fail.text: You catch nothing but your own fingers and a thorn. Hunger stays loud.

outcomes.title: Beg at a Farm Gate
outcomes.desc: Ask for bread with your hands open and your eyes down.

success.text: A farmer’s wife watches you for a long moment, then presses a heel of bread into your palm. You eat with shame, and you live.

fail.text: The gate stays shut. Someone laughs from behind it. Hunger doesn't just hurt; it humiliates.

name: Soup Line at Wrenfield
prompt: Wrenfield’s chapel offers thin soup to anyone willing to queue under the eyes of the righteous. You can smell it from the street. So can everyone else.

outcomes.title: Take the Bowl
outcomes.desc: Let them stare. You’re still alive.

success.text: The soup is mostly water, but it is warm and real. Shame is not fatal, despite what pride insists.

fail.text: You reach the front—and the pot runs dry. The disappointment hits you like a punch.

outcomes.title: Volunteer Instead
outcomes.desc: Earn your meal with your hands and keep a shred of dignity.

success.text: You haul water and chop onions until your eyes burn. When you finally sit, the soup tastes like victory.

fail.text: You work, but the overseer finds fault in you that isn't there. You still eat—barely—but the kindness comes with a hook.

outcomes.title: Steal a Ladle
outcomes.desc: If mercy is rationed, take your share.

success.text: Your hand is quick. The ladle is hot, and so is the guilt, but you eat. Later, you hear your description passed between guards like a prayer.

fail.text: You’re caught with soup on your sleeve. Hunger turns into a public lesson.

name: Bandage and Bone
prompt: A traveling surgeon sets up near a wagon, his tools laid out like cutlery. He looks at your wound and hums. "You can keep it," he says, "or we can fix it."

outcomes.title: Pay the Surgeon
outcomes.desc: Clean stitches and pain you can trust.

success.text: Coin buys competence. The stitching is quick, and the bandage is tight. You walk away with fewer stars in your vision.

fail.text: The surgeon takes your coin and does what he can. It's not enough to make you whole, but it keeps you from rotting.

outcomes.title: Endure Field Treatment
outcomes.desc: Let him work. Don't flinch. Don't scream.

success.text: You bite down on cloth and take it. When it's done, the wound is angry but contained. You are still you.

fail.text: The pain breaks your focus and the work goes rough. Days later the wound is swollen and hot.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: You’ve survived so far. Maybe you'll keep surviving.

success.text: You keep moving. The surgeon shrugs; he's seen stubborn before. You learn, along the road, what your body will not forgive.

fail.text: You move—and the wound complains loudly. Not yet fatal, but eager to become so.

name: Training Yard Mishap
prompt: A friendly bout turns sour when someone misjudges distance, or pride, or both. Steel kisses flesh, and suddenly the world is all bright pain.

outcomes.title: Push Through the Pain
outcomes.desc: If you stop, you lose face. If you continue, you might lose more.

success.text: You finish the bout on sheer will. People cheer. You smile. Inside, something tears.

fail.text: You push too hard and fall wrong. The crowd goes quiet. Your opponent looks sick with it.

outcomes.title: Yield Gracefully
outcomes.desc: Call it before it becomes a story told at your expense.

success.text: You step back, raise a hand, and concede with dignity. It's a small loss that saves a larger one.

fail.text: You yield—and someone laughs anyway. You swallow it, but it lodges in your throat.

outcomes.title: End It Quickly
outcomes.desc: A sudden lunge, a decisive strike. No room for accidents.

success.text: You move like you meant it, and the bout ends before it turns cruel. Some call it efficient. Others call it suspiciously sharp.

fail.text: You overcommit. Someone goes down hard and doesn't get up fast enough. The yard-master's gaze turns cold.

name: Collector’s Knock
prompt: A runner finds you with practiced ease. "My master remembers your arrangement," she says, smiling like a knife. "He also remembers when it was due."

outcomes.title: Pay Something Now
outcomes.desc: Not all of it—just enough to keep the knives in their sheaths.

success.text: You pay what you can. The runner counts it, nods, and leaves. The debt remains, but it loosens its grip on your throat.

fail.text: You offer coin and excuses. The runner takes the coin and leaves the excuses on the floor. The arrangement worsens.

outcomes.title: Offer Service Instead
outcomes.desc: If you can't pay with coin, pay with time.

success.text: You write, you carry, you observe—small tasks with sharp edges. The runner returns later with a receipt and a warning: "Don't do this twice."

fail.text: Your 'service' is noted, then declined. The debt is not impressed by your creativity.

outcomes.title: Hide From the Knock
outcomes.desc: If they can’t find you, they can’t collect.

success.text: You vanish into alleys and borrowed doors. The runner leaves empty-handed, and you keep breathing. For now.

fail.text: You duck away—and step straight into another pair of eyes. Hiding becomes its own crime.

name: A Risky Loan
prompt: A moneylender offers you coin with a smile too wide. "No shame," he says. "Just terms." His inkpot is already open.

outcomes.title: Take the Loan
outcomes.desc: Coin now. Consequences later.

success.text: You sign. Coin changes hands. For one shining moment, the future is quiet.

fail.text: You sign—and the terms shift as you do. By the time you notice, you're already deeper than you meant to be.

outcomes.title: Walk Away
outcomes.desc: Some offers are traps made of kindness.

success.text: You refuse and keep your name your own. It doesn't solve your lack of coin, but it keeps you from kneeling to it.

fail.text: You refuse—and the moneylender laughs. "You'll be back," he says, and the laugh follows you down the street.

outcomes.title: Negotiate the Terms
outcomes.desc: Change the shape of the trap so you can see the teeth.

success.text: You rewrite the bargain until it is merely dangerous, not fatal. You take coin—and keep a measure of control.

fail.text: You try to outtalk a professional. He lets you try. Then he wins.

name: Whispers at the Market
prompt: People look at you a beat too long, then pretend they weren't. The rumor has traveled ahead of you and set up a stall.

outcomes.title: Confront the Whisperer
outcomes.desc: Pick a target and make them regret speaking.

success.text: You make the whisperer flinch, and the flinch tells a story louder than words. The rumor loses momentum.

fail.text: You grab the wrong person. Now the rumor has proof to cling to.

outcomes.title: Do a Public Kindness
outcomes.desc: Let your actions drown out their words.

success.text: You pay for a stranger’s medicine. You carry a basket for an old man. You don't announce it. People notice anyway.

fail.text: You try to be seen being kind, and it reads as performance. The market shrugs and moves on, leaving you where you started.

outcomes.title: Lean Into It
outcomes.desc: If they want a villain, give them a better one—on your terms.

success.text: You smile at the stares and let them build their own myths. In the shadows, you learn who profits from your bad name.

fail.text: You play the villain and attract the wrong kind of attention. Someone decides you’re worth watching closely.

name: The Apology Rite
prompt: An elder of the Lantern Order offers a rite of apology—salt, water, and a public admission. It won't erase the rumor, but it can change its flavor.

outcomes.title: Submit to the Rite
outcomes.desc: Speak the words and let the crowd take what it wants.

success.text: You kneel, you speak, you accept the sting. The crowd exhales. Your name doesn't become clean, but it becomes usable again.

fail.text: You try, and your pride ruins the cadence. The elder sighs. "Not yet," she says, and the rumor keeps its teeth.

outcomes.title: Offer a Donation Instead
outcomes.desc: Let coin stand in for contrition.

success.text: The elder accepts your coin without smiling. "It helps," she says, which is the closest thing to forgiveness you get today.

fail.text: Your donation is noticed for the wrong reasons. "Trying to buy it off," someone mutters.
