outcomes.title: Refuse
outcomes.desc: If they want your head bowed, make them work for it.

success.text: You refuse with calm certainty. Some respect it. Others hate it. Both are fuel.

fail.text: You refuse with heat, and the heat makes a story. The story spreads.

name: Herbal Poultice
prompt: A hedge-healer offers you a poultice that smells like crushed nettle and rain. "Bruises are just stories the body tells itself," she says. "We can change the ending."

outcomes.title: Apply the Poultice
outcomes.desc: Let it sting. Let it work.

success.text: The sting fades into warmth. By morning the bruise has turned from angry purple to a quieter yellow.

fail.text: You smear it on and hope. It helps a little, but not enough to call it a cure.

outcomes.title: Pay for a Proper Salve
outcomes.desc: She has better tools if you have coin.

success.text: The salve is clean, sharp-smelling, and expensive. It works.

fail.text: It works… eventually. Your bruise doesn't care about your schedule.

outcomes.title: Tough It Out
outcomes.desc: Pain is temporary. Pride insists it is eternal.

success.text: You move anyway. The bruise becomes background noise, and your stubbornness becomes a story someone admires.

fail.text: You move anyway, and the bruise moves with you—louder each hour. Stubbornness turns into fatigue.

name: A Chance Encounter
prompt: A spring gathering draws merchants, wardens, and minor houses into the same lantern-lit square. Amid the crowd, a steward hints that a certain lady has been asking after your name.

outcomes.title: Ask for an introduction
outcomes.desc: Spend a little coin on a small gift and put your best words forward.

success.text: You send a polite word and a modest token. The steward smiles—there will be a meeting.

fail.text: Your attempt lands poorly—too bold, too late, or too plain. The steward’s smile thins.

outcomes.title: Keep your distance
outcomes.desc: Watch, listen, and learn—without stepping into the light.

success.text: You learn more than names: loyalties, debts, and the shape of the room.

fail.text: You linger too long. Someone notices. The chance passes.

outcomes.title: Refuse the game
outcomes.desc: You’ve survived worse than gossip. Better to keep your heart and purse unentangled.

success.text: You leave early. No one can pull a thread you never offered.

fail.text: Even refusal becomes talk. People invent reasons.

name: Words Over Wine
prompt: A private table is arranged—close enough for scrutiny, far enough for whispers. Your prospect arrives with a measured smile. Somewhere behind you, a chaperone pretends not to listen.

outcomes.title: Charm the table
outcomes.desc: Give them a reason to remember you kindly—and loudly.

success.text: Laughter lands where you place it. Even the chaperone seems almost amused.

fail.text: A joke turns, a compliment sours, and the room finds it easier to judge than forgive.

outcomes.title: Listen, then speak
outcomes.desc: Ask what matters to them. Let the answer shape your next words.

success.text: You notice what they avoid and what they lean toward. When you answer, it fits.

fail.text: You talk past each other, each too polite to admit the mismatch.

outcomes.title: A daring aside
outcomes.desc: Risk a private note—something too honest for chaperones.

success.text: The note is read once, then hidden. Their eyes flick to yours—brief, bright, conspiratorial.

fail.text: The note is found by the wrong hands. A cough, a glance, a sudden frost in the room.

name: Vows and Dowry
prompt: The steward returns with terms. Gifts, witnesses, obligations. A marriage is never only two people—it is ledgers and promises, watched by those who profit from both.

outcomes.title: Negotiate with honesty
outcomes.desc: Promise only what you can keep. Ask only what you can bear.

success.text: The terms settle. Witnesses nod. A ring—simple, stubborn—finds your hand.

fail.text: Numbers tangle. Someone takes offense. The day ends without vows.

outcomes.title: Buy certainty
outcomes.desc: A heavier purse smooths sharp edges—if you can afford it.

success.text: Coin speaks. The witnesses hear it clearly.

fail.text: You offer too little, or the purse is seen as insult. The door closes—for now.

outcomes.title: Make it a private vow
outcomes.desc: Skip the theater. Keep the words between you—and risk the room’s opinion.

success.text: You speak the vow without witnesses. It feels truer. It looks worse.

fail.text: You try to keep it quiet—but quiet things can still be dragged into daylight.

name: The First Cry
prompt: The household goes hushed. Water boils. Footsteps hurry. For hours, your world narrows to breath and candlelight—then, at last, the sound you were half-afraid to want.

outcomes.title: Hire the best midwife
outcomes.desc: Spend coin for calmer hands and cleaner linens.

success.text: The midwife is steady, unhurried. When it is done, the child’s cry cuts through the night like a bell.

fail.text: You pay, but luck is not for sale. The household is left wrung out and wary.

outcomes.title: Stand vigil
outcomes.desc: Hold the hand. Speak the old comforts. Endure what you must.

success.text: Dawn finds you hollow-eyed, but alive. The child is too.

fail.text: The night takes its toll. Whatever comes next, you feel older for it.

outcomes.title: Pray, and let others labor
outcomes.desc: Step outside. Trust the house. Bargain with whatever listens.

success.text: Your prayer is answered—or you simply chose the right people to trust.

fail.text: You return to a colder room. No one meets your eyes for long.
